review_body: Great hotel, very old building with strange noises and slow elevators.Easy to get lost trying to find your roomWould be great if they added hot breakfast instead of the $12 Continental offeringThe service fee should include the Continental breakfast

The location and rooms were nice. The amenities were lacking and a few of the front desk staff were not necessarily very friendly. The room was fairly quiet although there were some weird noises coming from the pipes that would wake us up.

Perfectly situated, super friendly & helpful staff. Beautiful rooms & very clean. Brilliant service. Will visit again & refer everyone I know.The friendly staff & eagerness to make my holiday memorable was the highlight of my stay there.

I was a little worried at first from photos online, but was pleasantly surprised when I stayed at Luxe Life. Our room was clean, quiet and a very comfortable bed. I didn’t hear one city street noise at all. The only downside is if you’re lookin for a room with a view or even lookout, this is not it. But we didn’t mind as we were out all day in the city. It was nice to have a quiet, darker room. The bathroom is pretty nice, but small. But, things in NY tend to be that way. Again, cannot say enough about how comfortable the bed was. This spot was a great location as well. It’s so close to Herald Square and perfect midtown location. We scored free parking (on weekend) on the same street just a few blocks down. For the price, location and overall enjoyment, this is one of the places to stay. Also, with the resort fee, they give you Voss water bottles each day. Very pleased with accommodations and communication with the staff.

The Luxe Life Hotel is a great place to stay right in the heart of NYC. Easily assessible to tourist as well as business destinations. The hotel has nicely appointed rooms with new marble bathrooms and hardwood floors. They offer a great breakfast buffet in the morning and were just opening their new restaurant and lounge. It is definitely worth giving this hotel a try, you will Love It!!!

My boyfriend and i have a date night in manhattan once and week and enjoy staying at the different hotels NYC has to offer. This was our first time staying at a LIFE hotel and needless to say, we were impressed. The decor was luxe, yet comforting. Simple and contemporary yet classic in its design. The staff was very friendly and the accommodations were to our standards. We even ordered room service for breakfast! (we dont usually do this) The menu was perfect and affordable. The food came quickly and tasted great! (I had the California breakfast sandwich) We love this hotel and hope to stay again soon!

This is the only hotel I stay at in NYC. It’s clean, fun, luxurious, and in a fantastic location. The staff are friendly and know the area and will make suggestions for entertainment, shopping and more!Lots of history in this building. Craft cocktail anyone? You bet!Most comfortable beds!

If you value a comfortable bed, this is most definitely not the hotel for you. The beds are made frommetal so you’ll hear chinking and clanking with every move you make, and the mattresses are so so soft you can barely move for sinking. They are deeply uncomfortable and my back is ACHING!The staff are so-so - when I called to ask for a different room (and a different bed!) I was dismissed... “oh, yes, some complain they’re too hard, some say too soft, but they’re all the same, so....”. The hallways need updating and feel a bit sad. Rooms are small, bathroom are fine but don’t expect them to restock shampoo or toilet paper everyday. All in all this is a 5/10.

Warm kind staff, amazing location, clean hotel with fabulous stylish features. We would definitely stay here again. Bathroom was tiny but very pretty. Bed was comfortable and the lighting was very pretty.

I was very pleasantly surprised at the size of the bathroom especially (in these old quirky buildings, that can be tough to do) I stayed on the 9th floor and it was very quiet and comfortable. I do wish the lighting was better in the building itself - lobby and hallways. The lighting in the rooms was great though.

Our room was cute BUT we had issues with 1) the toilet running all night of our first night there and 2) first the shower only ran frigid water and the second night, the water was literally scalding. If we turned it down, the water again became ice cold; there was no in between. Also, the water filters inside tje ice closets were filthy.

Beautiful classy and affordable lodgings in a historic New York building. Friendly, helpful staff. Free 24 hour coffee, and breakfast. Just a great value. A much needed respite during a stressful trip. Can’t recommend higher.

This small hotel, with very caring Receptionists and a wonderful cold breakfast, is on the edge of the Theatre District between Broadway and 5th Avenue. A "Boutique" hotel with small rooms and a large bathroom. Every light switch has a dimmer switch!

Fanstastic: location, breakfast, staff courtesy, room, clean, service and all were incredible.Price very good if you book in advance.Room for 3 with my little doughter (4).Close to the metro station, literally few steps fromThe 5ft avenue and the Empire State Building

Wonderful service from a small staff that really made every effort to please. Our room was very comfortable & well equipped with everything you might need. Excellent lighting in the updated rooms & a lovely light breakfast buffet.

Awesome hotel in good locationStaff are all angels and beds are divine Hotel is beautifully restored Will recommend it time and again to all my business and personal friends Can’t wait to go back soon

I am really sorry to come to this,and I even understand that debit problems can happen during transactions but I stayed at this hotel more than one month ago, my credit card was debited twice, and after several calls and e-mails I havo NO ANSWER regarding this problem.Extremely disappointed.

The reason I am giving this hotel a 3 is because it was really average but not terrible. The positives of this hotel is of course the price, very affordable. The bed is definitely comfortable as well and the bathrooms are larger than one would expect in NY. The bed is what would lead us to return again if ever necessary. When we went, there was also a free breakfast provided which is definitely a plus. They provided croissants, fresh fruit, coffee and juices. On the second floor is a small gym and a little area for coffee and tea whenever you like as well as a computer and printer. The negatives include the front desk customer service which is lacking. I am not confident that they are trained adequately to provide the best service as check in was lack luster. A call to the front desk started with “What?” which left me quite shocked that some time has passed before I responded. The hotel itself is also rather dark, there are only 2 elevators that are quite small. The hallways themselves are also small and especially if you are on the top floors. The room’s decor is played up in the website’s pictures but walking in was somewhat disappointing. I understand that they have an aesthetic they are trying to do but the execution just made the room look dirty (ie. The “vintage” looking mirrors and side tables). Another reviewer from before mentioned the floors looking dirty which I quite agree but it is only due to the style of the flooring. A rug in some areas could ameliorate this. It was not comfortable walking on those floors without slippers (which they didn’t have). The balcony offering was also quite odd but that is a room we got and it did have a nice view- if you look up. The furniture placed outside just seemed like an after thought. Overall it was an average stay that could use improvements in order to enhance guest experience. This hotel has a lot of potential that they have yet to tap into.

This hotel has a decent location, and the first floor is eclectic in decor. The rooms lack dressers and the bathrooms lack any drawers or counters or places to put your toiletries. The bed was incredibly soft, almost like a cushion. The water was impossible to get warm - it was either cold or burning hot. The breakfast was convenient and acceptable. The room was extremely small and poorly laid out, with odd little pieces of furniture.

Very good location.The staff is friendly.The room is small, and the bathroom is too small.The heating system is not good, not sufficient for very cold days. Moreover, it is noisy.The hotel is overpriced for what it offers.

This is a cute boutique hotel in the heart of midtown with easy access to the Empire State Building , Macy's, Penn Station. The staff is amazing and my room was very very quiet. The heating and cooling systems make some noise but you hear no traffic noise at all. Missed having the restaurant/bar in the hotel. Hopefully they will at least get a bar soon.

I have been to NY city several times over the years. Each time with a varying degree of success in locating a hotel that meets our needs. Hands down, the Life Hotel was the best NY experience I have had. The property is beautiful, rooms well appointed and decorated on point. Loved the character of the building and the thoughtfulness of the interior decorations and amenities. Highly recommend this property!

The hotel is located on 31st street, which is central and close to Penn station. Check-in was fast and front desk gave me access to my room 1 hour earlier from my check-in time. Breakfast fast was reasonable and they have 24 hour free coffee station on the 1st floor. The staff was friendly and cooperative. The room was clean and tidy but a little small for my expectation, this forced me to stay out and explore NY city. Bathroom was reasonably spacious and clean with hot water. Check-out was also very fast.

I took a chance. Which I don't like to do on hotels. The price was $138 / night on Hotels.com. I was in NYC for business and trying to sneak in on the cheap... Well this hotel was ADORABLE. Room was SO quiet, I slept like a baby. Beds so comfy and rooms well done and styled. Staff were above and beyond. Free breakfast!? And drink coupons I forgot to use at the wine bar next door. They even have a decent gym with new equipment! And blocks from flatiron building, subway & Penn station. Great experience and location. Thank you!

New York City, New York

review_body: I went to NY for work and loved my stay at the property. The location is amazing, walking distance to great restaurants, nightlife and attractions if you are going for fun. The rooms are very spacious (contrary to the norm in NY) and beautifully decorated. They have a small but well appointed complimentary breakfast at the lobby which came really handy with my tight schedule. The small hotel feel definitely convinced me to book again next time I'm in the city.

I stayed at the Life Hotel for 1 week and I must say that I absolutely loved it. The employees are just amazing- from Mayra, Bryant, Istiria, Rich, Francisco, Agouda, Brandon, to EVERY single housekeeper I came into contact with. The service was warm and inviting and everyone was accommodating.My room was so clean. The bed was very comfortable and I was able to open a window for some clean air. The ceilings are high and the floors are cool with its concrete and original wood design. The bathrooms were bright with a great design and proper water pressure. The hotel has an old-world charm, really beautiful architecture, a cozy atmosphere with beautiful wood design in lobby juxtaposed with original steel beams and Edison bar lighting. I must note that the wifi is excellent too.Morning breakfast was served in the lobby and it was easy to have a quick morning bite before heading out into the streets of NY.There is a pizza place called- Little Italy Pizza around the corner from the hotel on 33rd off of 5th and the next door restaurant- Ayza was just awesome, serving wine and different chocolate martinis. There are 3 CVS drugstore in walking distance that are open 24 hours so it is very convenient if you forgot to pack somethings- like I did.I was able to walk to EAtaly for incredible food and chocolate, the Empire state Building, flower market and all the little stores so close to the neighborhood. The subway is very close and you can get around all over town very efficiently.Last but not least- the hotel manager, Ferran, provided excellence in hospitality, welcoming guests to the hotel and making sure they had everything they needed to make their stay comfortable and memorable.If you need a great hotel centrally located in New York with incredible service- Life Hotel is my suggestion.

The personal and the amenities are perfect. De manager great person, the front desk people are very kind, always to our service, The room perfect, the rate was fear. Good breakfast . I resume We enjoy the stay in he hotel

After the numerous negative reviews I read on Google I was very happy with our stay at Life Hotel. Our check-in with Mira was extremely pleasant and she was fantastic to deal with, as were all the other staff we spoke to or were assisted by.The hotel had a small selection of breakfast which is new and I really appreciated having this available each day, especially on the morning of the marathon. Maybe some warm food or more continental offerings as a suggestion and slightly better coffee? The hotel is a bit dark in the lobby, but I assume that is part of the ambience they have gone for.Our room, 411, was great but a bit dark as it was at the back of the building. However, it was a welcome break from the busy and noisy NYC streets. Overall was a great stay and I am glad we booked here and didn't book elsewhere based on the negative reviews we had read. It is very central and a great based to have to explore NYC and the surrounding Boroughs.

Great hotel and service.. Even with such small room, it was very comfortable.. The shower is REALLY hot, and it was a bit stressful to adjust.. Water and ice on the floor. Location is good as well :-)

Great location - right in the center of it all. LOVED my room and the industrial look! The team really went over and beyond. Upon checking out, I was running late and getting worried about missing my flight... BUT a Life Hotel team member (sorry cant remember his name) got out on the street and helped me hail a taxi. Thank you - I will be back!

I havent written reviews for a while but felt compelled in this instance to leave one.I read a lot of not-so-good reviews beforehand and was not sure what i was in for.Well i was pleasantly surprised!Check-in was easy, Mira was lovely and called to make sure my room was ok soon after.The room and ensuite were tiny as expected but nicely appointed, clean and quiet. The bed was heavenly, big tv, ac unit worked fine, hot water with ok pressure, no clogs etc.I failed to see what other travellers were complaining about the lobby looking abandoned and what not, might have just been addressed before my stay. To one side-the bar, to the other- nicely decorated booths/lounges. The vibe was cozy, warm & quaint, especially at night. Always looked inviting through the windows as i returned every night.Yes lifts were slow but expected for the age of the building. The tv remote wasn't the most responsive - minor gripes really.For the price point I had a perfectly nice stay!(on one hand I've stayed at worse for dearer but on the other I've also stayed at the Plaza).Thumbs up.

Thank you to the Life Team for welcoming me into your home. I found the staff to be friendly and always willing to assist. A few names to mention are Aziz, Mariya, Bryant, Nicole, William, Brandon, and more... I believe in top down management so it starts at the top. Big kudos to Ferran for his dedication, drive, and genuine hospitality. Bravo to the team and I look forward to my next visit.Sincerely,Adrienne

This is such a lovely hotel with a fascinating history. Every staff member was gracious and helpful. I adore staying in boutique hotels and travel extensively. This hotel did not disappoint. If you are looking for a beautiful room, excellent service, and a great location this is the place for you!

The location is good. The rooms are clean and the price is reasonable. This could become one of my new favorites. I stayed here for business in July and liked the location and the room was clean, not huge but it had everything you need. The lobby was a little disorganized as they had closed down their restaurant and bar so it just looked a little bereft. Now they have put lobby furniture in and they had a nice little breakfast buffet in the bar in the morning. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. It was very nice and a great deal for NYC.

We stayed here for two nights when we had to come to town on a family emergency. The location is great, near Penn Station, Herald Square, within walking distance of many places you would want to visit. We had a room on one of the upper floors. It did not have a view, but it was nice and quiet. The room was small, but by NYC standards it was fine. The beds were comfortable. The wifi worked very well. Our bathroom was a nice size. It would have been nice if the room had a small fridge and a little more space to put things like suitcases, etc. The staff were very friendly, and even let us check in early since our room was ready. It was sad that the restaurant and bar were not open; it looked like it would be a nice space to hang out in. I'm not sure if they went out of business, or just aren't open very much. The elevators were old and slow, but they added charm. We convinced ourselves that one was haunted because the lights would flash and the phone inside would go off and on for no reason. (Hey! It's an old building!) I'd stay here again.

It is an average hotel with very small rooms. It does a job but don't expect anything extra. The closed bar and restaurant are disappointing. The location is great and it does a perfect job if you spend most of your time exploring New York

I have stayed in several hotels in NY (including some renowned 5 star hotels) but this is by far my favorite! The staff and managers are incredibly friendly and helpful (particularly Bryant, Istra, Fransico and Donna) The rooms are very clean, spacious and quiet. The hotel itself posses an old-world charm and cosy atmosphere with classy design and decor. The wifi is excellent and there are water filters which are incredibly convenient. I'll definitely be back again and again and again. :)

This hotel is a complete rip off! They sold this hotel as a 4 star hotel! It’s not a 4 start hotel, turns out it’s a 3 star hotel! There is no room service! Bed Bugs were found in both my room and my colleagues room who also checked in here! The room is horrible and looks nothing like the photos! Complete rip off and liars and they refused to refund!

Five stars to the room’s cleanliness, everything else leaves a whole lot to be desired. I stayed there for 4 nights, would have opted not to had I not booked a non-refundable stay. The restaurant and the bar at the hotel’s entrance are closed (permanently?) leaving most of the ground floor dark. This is a recurring theme throughout the property, the (slow) elevators, stairwells, (narrow) hallways are all dimly lit! Safety and security became a big concern.Housekeeping just knocks and almost unannounced immediately just opens the door to go about their duty. Kudos to them though for doing a good job cleaning the room(s).I may stay elsewhere next time.

Great hotel, contemporary interior, very clean. Staff were helpful and attentive. It is just a short walk from Empire State and a number of subway stations. Also do a good happy hour if you’re around at the right time.

I’m always trying to find the small, stylish hotels when travelling, and this place was tempting; located in the old Life Magazine-building, and refurbished as a boutique hotel in 2017, it sure fitted my preferences.Also the lication is good; it is in the blick just next to Empire State Building, and only 150 m off Broadway.But...., this hotel still didn’t quite meet my expectations. The rooms are «cold», with old concrete floors, which are indeed beautiful, yet not very comfortable with bare feet, and the room is is in general very minimalistic. The AC is bad.... you know, one of these noisy boxes high on the wall with a remote control. Such a place would have deserved a centralised, quiet ventilation system. My room was otherwise small, but that don’t bother me at all. The best part was the bathroom, which was nicely decorated in an classic, «old NYC» way (yet entirely new).There is big potential to improve the reception; I learned that the lobby restaurant and bar had gone bankurupt recently, and the entire lobby therefore looks exactly like that; a place which has been closed down, with chairs on the tables and a not so good atmosphere.Also the corridors are a bit strange; by original design they are narrow, but the 2017 designer hasn’t done a good job with the color- and light design....and the service in the reception could have been better. When we asked for a late check out, the answer was «yes, I can do noon». That’s not a late check out.... And the receptionist spent much more time calling the baggage man / janitor(?), than it would take for him to move our suitcases the 2 m(!!) into the baggage room. But when and if the bar and restaurant is up and running again, and if they do something about the gloomy corridors and the messy lobby (and put a nice rug og the floors in the rooms) this place will improve much, and I might come back :-)

Booked through hotel.com and was disappointed when I arrived to find that the hotel bar & restaurant (which I was looking forward to using) had closed recently and they had not updated their website, 3rd party booking sites or informed me before I arrived. It made the lobby feel very sad! My room was dusty, particularly the lights. On arrival I was charged a $37.87 USD “resort fee” per night for “fitness centre, wifi and in-room bottled water.” I should have read the small print (dOh)2 bottles of water received on arrival were not replaced for my whole 5 night stay!! When requested more, they refused! Apparently I was to check out each day, and check back in ...as the only way to get more bottled water!!! A small thing but the staff’s attitude and unwillingness to fix a small issue made this a bigger issue than it needed to be!!

Massive mistake booking this for a 3 night work trip. I should have read the reviews or done some further investigation, I was fooled by the very amazing photograph on booking.com. On arrival I was confused from the outside, it looked like the same building but it looked closed and not like its grand images. There’s nobody to great you, you have to carry your bags up the stairs into the closed bar and restaurant, that’s dark and actually just weird. Hidden at the back left corner is a tall reception desk with one person hidden behind it. Some toilets behind it and it felt like we were in a service area rather than a nice lobby, check in was easy. Hardly anything was said, no information give at all. No idea If they took a hold on my card or for how much. Handed a key and off I went. Now it’s not even been mentioned that the ground floor bar and restaurant are completely closed, I know as it’s like a ghost town and I did some review reading when I got to my room. The lift is dark and takes forever, corridors are nicely decorated but again dark and very quiet, feels like I’m the only person staying in a completed closed hotel! On entering the room, it is clean and it does kind of look like the images, however it is not bright and welcoming like the pictures, The premium king room had no window or view or light of any sort. I feel very walled in and actually not very safe. It’s basic, nice basic furniture but there’s nothing amenities wise, no mini bar, no coffee machine, nothing. There’s also a massive and very noisy box on wall air-condition system. One amenity I’m not so happy to see. There’s no room service, now this just drives me mad, staying in a hotel on your own for work this is really important. All you can get in this entire hotel is a small bottle of water in your room, that’s it, no breakfast in the morning. Nothing. Surely it should mention this somewhere in the booking information, it’s a common necessity people take for granted as being included at this price point, so if it’s not, it needed to be SPELT OUT IN CAPS. I feel completely ripped off and like I’m staying in the hotel from The Shining. I’ve stayed in a new hotels for the same price close to this (The James) that was everything this hotel is not. I booked a non refundable rate and therefore stuck for the stay or the other choice is to rebook again elsewhere, which to be honest it even looked into for around $850 dollars for 3 nights. Complete rip off. Read the reviews.

I should have suspected something was off when I called the week before and found the phone system was down. The first line was a fast busy repeatedly, so I tried several other extensions. No luck. Some had "full" mailboxes. Not a good omen.I should note that we have stayed here before and loved it. There was a bar and a restaurant in the lobby both of which got high marks. We specifically choose hotels with restaurants and bars so that we do not have to go out searching for breakfast or a night cap. When we arrived to find both were closed, we were extremely disappointed and expressed that to the manager. His response was simply that they had closed unexpectedly about a month before and that it was "before his hiring". What kind of answer is that? Very dismissive.The next morning, I went to get coffee that was supposed to be provided and found that it was being serviced and the wait would be 15 minutes. Luckily, I had time and was able to go back. However, it was a sorry cup of coffee. No milk or cream only chemical laden Coffee Mate. The next two days NONE. The computer was also "out of order".Also, both the tub and the sink didn't drain, and the air conditioner put out air, but it wasn't cold. These things WERE fixed when brought to the attention of the front desk.This hotel is dark, lifeless and basically OUT OF ORDER!! Unless you have a dirt-cheap deal and need ZERO services, I highly recommend finding someplace else.

First of all yes, the bar and the restaurant are both closed. Had I paid top dollar for a full package hotel I would’ve been irate, but I didn’t- so I wasn’t. That said, I spent 4 days here with my daughter and we loved it. The location was perfect for us. Easy walk from Penn Station, Times Square (my least fave spot in NYC but had to go there for a particular store), and right around the corner from K-Town food and shops.  We had room 802 and it was a dream room for me. The old details left in place, a super comfy bed, huge TV, and great shower. The huge window with bright sunshine pouring in and an open street view was a 1st for me. Usually city hotels give you a view of a wall, alley, or opposite window- this was heaven. Old cement/wood floors, subway tile, octagon bathroom tiles, clean white decor was beautiful and simple. The staff were all super friendly and the bonus fridge in the room that I didn’t expect was great.  I will gladly stay here again if I can get the right price.

Had booked a 5 night non refundable stay at this hotel. The photos online were misleading,the hotel room was unliveable.The floors were cracked and had filth on them.Had to leave without a refund and pay at another hotel .Please donot stay here.Posting some actual pictures I took of the room and the picture that is advertised on booking .com.

Stayed here for a couple days with family. The good: great room, loft-like and large for nyc standards with enough space for a 3rd bed. All mod-cons and neat. The not so great: reception is quite basic (no one to help with luggage to and from room) and the lifts slow and dark. There is no restaurant on-site (not that it matters in nyc and massive options close-by). Other than a few niggles, for a good price will stay here again.

This place is a masochists dream. The website is misleading. The bar and restaurant are closed to due "transitioning". Our room was behind the reception desk, past the public toilets and accounting office and down a short hallway. The room , although small, was fine although was showing wear and tear. The walls are paper thin and the woman who was in the throes of ecstasy for 105 minutes was audible to everyone within a 15 yard radius. It was as though she was in our room...seriously. The only thing that saved us was that the a/c unit was louder than a jet engine so we turned the temperature down to 67 so that it would continually cycle to muffle her moans. On the plus side, the bathroom was nice and so was the staff . The desk clerk modified our reservation to a king size bed which he did not need to do. We booked on Hoteltonight and at $250.00, including "Resort Fee"???!!! it was still overpriced. Do not even consider this place as an option.

I thought I had made a reservation at this hotel and my plans changed. I called to cancel and was told that there was no reservation with my name, credit card #, or any other identifying information. So I assumed that my own records were incorrect and took no further action. I apparently did have a reservation at the hotel because I was charged the full amount at the cancellation deadline time. I contacted the hotel immediately - within 5 minutes of being charged - to advise that I had tried to cancel but was told there was no reservation. They declined to reverse the charge, even after I spoke to a manager. I disputed the charge with my credit card company and the hotel simply provided a copy of my invoice stating that I had not canceled within the cancellation period. I understand that this is a lovely property; however, I strongly encourage you to keep very careful records of every little detail on your reservation. And if you call to cancel and they tell you you don't have a reservation, make sure you call again and again until you can get written confirmation that your reservation was canceled.

If you are searching for a place close to Times Square this is it. You can walk from here. Room is big enough with everything you need. In de evening there is always the sounds of people gathering which I loved. It seemed definitely a meeting point for allot of friends in the restaurant, cafe/bar.

Lovely hotel, great rooms, great location. Stayed there for my 60th Birthday. I'd stayed there before a few years ago and its been refurbished since then. We really liked the hotel. The rooms were quite small for four people but they now sleep only three people which is fine. Very clean, nice staff. Would definitely stay there again.

We traveled with my mother and son. The hotel at all wasn’t bad, but!“+”* In the middle of Manhattan. Two blocks from a train station.* Bright and tidy room. But not very cozy for a cold weather“-“ * there is no breakfast at all. You are able to have coffee and croissant in the bar downstairs. Mainly disappointment was about hospitality. At our first day I asked about possibility of late check out. We have a late all night flight back and it was very important to me to let my baby boy to have a nap. Very nice men on the front desk said that it’s is possible for half rate (but we need to check availability at the last day).At the last day I checked rooms from the web site, there was. But a lady on the redemption said that there was fully booked. I showed her wed site and explained about my situation. She and the other lady (seems like a manager) looked at each other and told me: “ Ok, but it coast full rate (for 3 hours)”. What?!!! So it means that they lied to me twice. I payed it, but they treated it like a big favor.I would never come again and never suggest this hotel. I think in your business people are the most important.

Beautiful pictures from the rooms to advertise but it’s a lie. Very poor rooms and service, I was with a 16 month old child and asked to have a fridge in the room to keep her milk, got denied cause the agent in the FO was mad cause they put me in a carpet room and I’m allergic so he had to change me for a different room and floor that was tile, when changed the room the side bed lamp was just resting in the wall and as soon as I went to lay in the bed the whole thing broke and the lamp kept hanging cloth to pillows until someone showed up to complete hip it off half an hour later. Not to mention that as I arrived to the hotel it was very confusing to find the entrance , that was not a single person to help with luggage.Both rooms I stayed had terrible views.

review_body: Located on 31st Street between Broadway and 5th, Life Hotel’s location couldn’t be better. Being a New Yorker all my life, I have never seen the appeal with staying in a hotel in or very near Times Square. The noise and the crowds are just too much for me. But I get it: some people who come to visit NYC see Times Square as the center of it all and to a degree it’s true. There are better areas in Manhattan to stay and where Life Hotel is located is one of them. Depending on who you ask, the neighborhood is Chelsea north, midtown south or even Koreatown. It doesn’t matter. It’s a great neighborhood. Quiet enough so you can get a good night’s rest but so close to anything you want to see either by walking or mass transit. I must say that the hotel’s signage and outside appearance do not standout. It’s not ugly or anything but it certainly doesn’t call much attention to itself. During my first stay, I walked right past the main entrance because I thought it was the entrance to the restaurant (recently closed as of this writing). The entrance area (for lack of a better word. There is no lobby in the classic sense) is problematic. You basically enter into what was once the restaurant’s space. The small reception area is in the rear left. You could easily miss it. Signage is not very prominent. The space is also dimly lit and the ceilings low. It’s got nothing style wise. Not drab. Just very unmemorable. Check in was fine. Staff were efficient and nice and handled my reservation well. First time I stayed on an upper floor (I think it’s only like 10 floors). Second time was on the 5th floor.Elevators are slow and small which is common in older buildings like this one. One is located near the reception area. The other is near a stairway. The stairway is actually rather nice so if you’re on the 2nd or 3rd floors, I’d suggest using them. Hallways also have zero style and are narrow. Like the other common areas of the hotel, there’s nothing horrible about them. It’s just that they don’t prepare you at all for what you get when you see YOUR ROOM.Ok. Now the great Stuff. The ROOM. The BED. What a surprise. So this is where the designers/developers put their money and they put it to good use. First time I stayed in a room in the back of the hotel it was big. Big high ceilings. Big bathroom. Big TV. And best of all, BIG brass bed. King size. Super comfortable. Did one person like me need a king size brass bed? No. Did one person like me like a king size brass bed? Oh Yes. The rooms are truly beautiful. All white including the bathrooms. Tastefully though minimally decorated which made the rooms feel even bigger. The floors were restored hardwood and in the room I stayed in during my second stay, there was a section that was (I think) concrete that was obviously part of the original building that lent an air of authenticity to the space that I really appreciated. It was bright, charming, peaceful and oh so comfortable. I really got a good night’s rest in those beds. Rooms came with the basic things you want and/or expect: toiletries, safe, iron plus one plush bathrobe that I liked. Everything was immaculate. I cannot say enough about these rooms and especially the beds. If you’re looking for a hotel with amenities like you’d find at a Hilton Garden Inn or the like, you’re not going to find them at the Life Hotel. It’s a special place and may not appeal to everyone. It excelled where I think it’s most important: the room. Five Stars for that.

New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Life for 4 nights. The herald square subway stop was about 5 minutes away by foot. The room itself is a bit of a hodgepodge of modern fixtures and 20's decor with chunks of hardwood flooring that doesn't match... smart TV and sleek lighting fixtures and weird grates for heating ducts. Elevator that can fit 3 people on a good day crawling up the building at a floor every 15 seconds or so. We still really enjoyed our stay here overall. The location is fairly central and the bed was comfy. Showers were also good, but the price was a big thumbs up.... when compared with other hotels on Manhattan.

An authentic piece of architectural beauty from the Gilded Age of NYC. Small, beautifully designed rooms are clean with groovy fixtures. The elevator and hallways are a bit dark but it’s part of the charm. It’s in the middle of the block so most of the rooms do not have windows with views, but we found it to be very quiet. The location was great in midtown, safe and walkable. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially Bryant at the reception desk. For the price it was a great stay.

This is a great little hotel in central Manhattan. Easy access all over the city. The room is clean and funky and relatively (for New York) quiet. You don’t get 4 star facilities but don’t let that put you off. I would definitely come back.The hotel has a couple of bars and a restaurant which all seem pretty cool. The reason I didn’t give this four stars is the awful woman on reception who firstly didn’t tell me where the lift was, secondly got grumpy when I asked for a receipt for city tax and finally did not tell me about ice machine, gym or free coffee (which I found out about after check out).

My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel for 6 nights, and were very glad with our choice! With it's clean, contemporary interior design, it provided a wonderful base for our jam-packed stay in New York City. We opted for the kingsize room which was a great decision, as the enormous bed was so comfortable, and the room a great size for the two of us. We did have issues with the TV however, and despite being on the 8th floor the street noise did wake me on a few occasions (but this comes with staying in "the city that never sleeps"). We found the staff friendly, and the location ideal in terms of getting around the city.Top tip: Take advantage of the happy hour deals at the bar downstairs, chicken wings at 25 cents a pop, it makes for a nice snack to take you from lunch through to dinner.

In a small but well designed en suit with a chi-chi bed was high art for this jaded traveler. The property appeals with its beaux arts facade and a hard to beat decor for its bar. The eatery takes its cue from African, Asian and Caribbean cuisine. Great location with peerless service from all dedicated, professional staff.

We stayed at Life hotel for 7 nights in June. Centrally located, clean and modern. I would stay here again based in the facilities and room. However the service at the reception and the bar is questionable and stopped me rating the experience and facilities as very good. A lady with red hair on the reception is extremely rude and not helpful on the most basic requests (asking for a ironing board and fork)

We booked the hotel for three nights in May and everything about the hotel was horrible , we just walked out and checked into double tree Hilton on Lexington which was cheaper and a million times better !! Such a waste of money !! Never got a refund

This hotel is amazing, the staff are amazing, the room was huge definitely worth the price I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The location is perfect, everything is walking distance. The is a liquor store across the street and a corner shop a few doors down. I am hoping to stay there again before the end of the year. Choose the King Premium Room with Sofa Bed!!

We needed a hotel for two nights on the weekend in New York City. Not easy to do in June or July. Life hotel popped up as an option and the price was right. So we took it. It’s a small building with a lot of history renovated many times but this current level of renovation provides clean But small rooms, and comfort for a night or two.Staff were lovely, and the elevator system is old and has a real feeling to it. A little research on the building shows that it used to be headquarters for at least a major component of time life. A small card that I have attached here shows a little bit of history. On the lobby level when you enter off the street there’s a bar and restaurant right in front of you. The reception is a little further in. We had dinner at the restaurant the first night. It is a nice Caribbean fusion type of restaurant but music was quite loud. Nevertheless this is New York.The hotel is also within walking distance to Penn Station, and the Herald Square Metro stop which is very convenient for getting around to most of New York City.Compared to some of the larger hotels in the vicinity, I would say this is a good deal.

With my 84 yr old mother, returning from Italy and stayed overnight before flying home to AZ the next morning. Stairs to front door, tough with luggage and no bellman to assist. The front desk is in the hallway where they waved us over without so much as opening the door for 2 elderly women. Rooms are clean but small; with a lovely view of the adjacent building's fire escape. After 11 hours of flying, the bed was wonderfully comfortable. I booked the room because they advertised that they had shuttle service- which they don't. Coffee is a self serve machine in paper cups on the 2nd floor. If you are young and able bodied, this is the place for you. Especially if you like a loud bar as you enter.

On arrival had to wait as we were early but when we came back had been upgraded very nice after along journey. We were on the sixth floor room wasn't huge but big enough bathroom was big and very clean. No view to speak of but who cares your not in New York to look out the window, the only draw back for me was the lack of drawers. The hotel is very central plenty round about it subway is only 3 blocks up or down. Didn't hear any noise at night.bed was large and comfortable great hotel if you want something small

Want to stay at a hotel with piss-poor service and attitudes from the staff (when they're actually around)? Or how about a General Manager (Ferran Sanfelimon) who doesn't know how to run a property? Then you should stay here and pay extra for crap service.I stayed for 6 nights. My first moment on property I had to carry my bags up the stairs into the lobby as there were no bellman around, no one to open the door and a front desk manager who couldn't be asked to greet me or look up from her computer until I said "Umm hello?" and then she finally looked up and said "I'll be with you in a moment". Not friendly at all, just attitude. NOT a good first impression. Also, they don't move people away from the front of the hotel to smoke (no one wants to enforce this or ask people to move a little away from the café), so you get to inhale cigarettes when you're sitting in the café even with the doors and windows closed since it's directly under the café window that people stand and smoke.2nd experience was in my bathroom - as soon as I got in the room I washed my hands and the water stayed in the sink not going down. I thought it was just an old hotel quirk so I ignored it and washed my hands again later and it got worse. The sink started to back up. So I pulled on the drain and took out the drain stopper and the most disgusting putrid smelling clump of hair that looked like a giant chia pet was clinging to the drain. I literally gagged at the smell of it and (should have taken a photo of that), called the housekeeper in to see this. She walked in the bathroom and said "OH MY GOD what is that?" And then apologized profusely and said "this isn't my room to clean the other cleans it". However, this had not been cleaned in years. For sure - there is no way someone cleaned that drain recently which is a testimony to how well management checks on the different departments. Vile! 3rd incident: I watched the same engineer (essentially a janitor type guy) sit on the couch on my 9th floor room and watch movies on his phone for at least 30 minutes every day. I snapped a photo since I thought it was poor management to allow this to go on (when doesn't a GM walk the floors?? Apparently when you're Ferran Sanfelimon and you hid in your office.) When I told the General Manager about it he acted suprised and asked to see the photo. I sent it to him and shared some feedback about my stay. Since it was a business trip and I was looking for a convenient hotel which I could return to again and again since I own my own company and travel, I thought it would be good to have a relationship with a hotel that I know, so I was feeling this one out. Sanfelimon offered me two breakfasts to compensate for any issues I had - really not a good tradeoff (there were others but I don't want to tire out my fingers typing that much). I accepted one breakfast but the service was awful. The waitress forgot to bring food we ordered, so even though we asked twice she said "the chef needs to get the avocadoes so it's going to take a few minutes". Really, and how long does it take to cut an avocado? So we finished our meal and got up to ask for the check (she never came back and was talking with another server -btw there was no one else in the restaurant), and they were looking at something on a phone which was way more important than doing her job). And bring the other thing we ordered? Ridiculous. Who trains this hotel staff? We gave her the card for a free breakfast and left. I emailed the GM again and said I didn't want to eat at the restaurant, and that I felt I had been more than understanding about the quirks so far and that I thought what would be fair was to offer to take one night off of my bill. He didn't respond. Surprised? Nahhh. So i emailed again when I returned home - just in case he was soooo busy he couldn't answer my email, but he stil didn't bother to respond. So just for one last hurrah, I tried again and it was ignored. This let me know that my business was not valued and so I am leaving this very honest review. I would never recommend this hotel or stay here again. Service was crap and the GM is terrible at his job and managing this staff who clearly hate their jobs.

A last minute booking for a work trip took me to the Life Hotel. The room was small but bright and clean. The bathroom was big (for NY city) and the elevator was small (also common for old buildings in NY). The best part was the cocktail bars that surround this place. So much good to eat (and drink) on this street and on 32nd.

review_body: The Life Hotel is in a great location for covering much of NYC on foot or using public transport. The room was well renovated, very clean and surprisingly spacious for central New York. Staff were courteous but disengaged. The hotel had run out of slippers - a bit of an issue given the polished concrete floors - and did not seem to have plans to get any more. The towels were clean and new but very small - why do hotels do this? The air con was effective at cooling the room but was way too loud to have in while sleeping. Overall a good hotel I would stay in again.

We should have cancelled before we arrived! We were incorrectly charged for our deposit, no response to our email queries and no response to the texts sent to the number they provided. We called them 3 times to sort the charging issue out before it was finally resolved.A week before we were due to arrive the balance of our accommodation came out and then the whole amount was taken again upon check-in. The staff argued with us telling us the money was not been charged twice and no apology was offered once they were proven incorrect. Now about the hotel...it has obviously been refurbished. The lifts were slow and old with a long wait time. The room we had was large but not at all functional. The TV was good, bed really comfortable however there was a very small amount of hanging space and power points were few and far between. The bathroom was spacious. The bar downstairs was nice and they did make a good cocktail.We found the overall service lacking and not at all welcoming. Certainly not a place we will return.

I won't go into every detail but will list my pros and cons and a few other points. My wife and I have been to NYC 3 times now and stayed in 3 hotels and a BnB. We understand that only the top hotels in NYC will be totally amazing but then you'll have to pay for the experience to stay in these. So please take this into account when staying in NYC whether it's here or somewhere else.Pros: Bright hotel room decor, lovely original fixtures entwined with some modern pictures and hall furniture, very good restaurant, bar and cocktail basement bar that's always lively but never too loud, rooms kept clean daily as is the halls, rooms have very comfy beds and air con/heater (typical NY style window unit), satellite tv in rooms, free drinks station on the 2nd floor serving coffee, tea and hot chocolate and reasonably well equipped gym on the 2nd floor open 24 hrs a day.We found the staff there to be very friendly and very helpful when asking for info and help despite other peoples reviews. Also I don't think the rooms are that small as people make out to be. Again, consider that this is a Manhattan hotel, the price of the rooms and that it is not a major chain or top 5 star hotel. If you want a big room it's like anything else, you pay for what you get.The hotel is very conveniently located for taking in NYC if you are new to the city. The nearest subway is Herald Square and you can get to anywhere in the city virtually from there.The restaurant and bar in the lobby was always busy but never intrusive. I've read good things about the restaurant and although not eating there, the food looked amazing when we passed through the lobby. There was alway soul and RnB music playing but never at loud volume.Cons:Needs a literature book supplied in the rooms to inform of amenities available. For example was told guests can use cast videos and films from smartphone/tablets to tv's in the room but no matter what I tried I could not get it to work, desk lamps have usb sockets to charge devices. If known upfront, would not bring a separate charger, in general other services were not explained or made known unless we asked for them. Also noted in other reviews is that the halls are dimly lit. However I noticed the room doors are not completely sealed and would let light into the room. But this never bothered my wife or me whatsoever.Another cool feature was the metal room doors and the magnets for the do not disturb signs. Cool and quirky.One thing we were not sure of (and we could be wrong) but my wife either read or heard that a free cocktail or drink was included with the stay but this was not mentioned or shown.On the whole we were very pleased with the standard set on our stay but a few little minor things would elevate the hotel.1: Literature books in the rooms2: Maybe an addition of free continental breakfast to accompany the free coffeeWould happily recommend this hotel for a 3,5 or 7 night stay for exploring the city.

We had a king premium room and it was an ok size for 2 people, not spacious but not too tight. The hotel itself is in a weird phase. It wants to be a 4 or 5 star but is really a 3.5. Pros: Clean rooms, good location (especially if you are wanting to do touristy things like walk around 5th ave), funky/cool restaurant in the lobby, comfortable bedCons: Unfriendly hotel staff, beds frames are noisy/cheap (the furniture in the room was not great quality), old/slow elevator that takes forever, tv didn't work as described

This is almost a hip, boutique hotel, but it is odd, even awkward. The rooms are fine, though small, bed is very comfortable, but has only a small window with a view of a wall.There is no service! The only person you have contact with is the front desk person.One coffee machine on the second floor for the entire hotel. And it was broken. Hallways are dark. Elevators are very slow and rickety. The overall experience was more of a why? Rather than a why not? It’s not that this is a bad place, it’s that there are other options at this price point that offer a better overall experience. It’s a hard hotel to classify, not bad, but not a great value. It’s clean, but feels a bit dingy because the dark hallways contrast so much with super-white, super lit rooms.

This hotel is clean and the beds are really comfortable however, the room we stayed in (Superior King) was too small for 2 adults. Could hardly swing a cat!!. So much so we couldn't unpack properly as there wasn't any cupboards or chest of drawers to put clothes in. The safe was also on the floor so not ideal for elderly people.No natural light in the room and the fan was situated directly next to the bed which was ridiculous.The reception staff were not very welcoming initially but the bar staff were friendly enough..On a plus note the hotel is next door to 2 fabulous restaurants. The Ayza and the Osamil! where the food in both restaurants was delicious.Good location for sight seeing

Love LIFE Hotel I’m a Hilton honors but I always forfeit to stay here when in nyc Fab cocktails and Afro fusion foodUpbeatCleanest I’ve ever stayed at I stay for biz and pleasureChristian is best bartender Chef JJ is awesomeFerran most personable hotel manager

My daughter and I stayed here for a quick 2 night getaway during spring break and absolutely loved it!! Check in was a breeze and our room was ready early. We were in room 809 with a king size bed and beautiful bathroom. No view but that was ok our room was quiet at night, no city noise could be heard just the ac/heater which wasn’t too loud. Bed was comfortable, shower pressure and water temp were great. We were so tired from all the city excitement and walking around we didn’t need the view. The front desk attendants were very polite and helpful during the trip, helping us get on the right train to get to the Bronx zoo. The hotel location is great, not far from Penn station, Time Square, Empire State Building. Plus the history of the building is cool, it was the former Life Magazine building that turned into a hotel. Overall very happy with our stay.

this place is perfect and well-priced; great location; quiet street; great food in their restaurant with energetic service stage; their bar is also great with yummy coffee, cocktails and non-stop awesome music.will be returning no-doubt

I had booked 5 rooms and looked to change hotel as we book about 200 night a year in NYC. we had several basic issues with the hotel which we complained about and they didnt solve. Therefore they said they will waive the resort fee and all we have to do is email them at info@hotmail.com which obviously is not their mail. Then they charged us for the fee and have been giving us all sort of excuses. Will for sure take my business elsewhere.

My stay was great mainly due to a wonderful front desk lady by the name of Catharine (if I’m not mistaken). She upgraded me to a larger room the first time I called to confirm my reservation, with even knowing me. She then welcomed me with a huge smile and an even bigger heart as I arrived and made sure I was ok. The location is wonderful if you are looking to explore both the lower side and enjoy midtown shows, shopping and entertainment options. The room was huge in terms on NYC hotels, clean and comfortable. It was also quite quiet at night, which is also a major plus. And the air in the room was pleasant and not dry and suffocating- another amazing advantage this time of year.

I absolutely love the location, ambiance/decor, and prices of this hotel. Some rooms are very small with no view (Except for the back fo a neighboring building), but they provide everything you need for a comfortable stay. I loved the smart TV in the room (though I couldn't add Netflix to it, and the interface was a little glitchy). My only complaint would be a combination of the staff and their room policy. I have stayed her multiple times for business travel, and my last reservation somehow ended on the wrong date. I tried to get clarification at check in, and the employee rolled her eyes at me, and continued to show her impatience with me trying to clarify the check out date. After that, I was provided with no options to check out on the earlier date, and paid for a full night despite not being there. As a returning customer, I think any response from staff, whether credits towards another hotel service or a voucher, would have been great. Other than that, walking through the loud bar to get to the hotel can be annoying, and the breakfast options are very limited.

They were accommodating to take our luggage in advance as we were moving from another hotel that morning. The rooms were exactly as they advertised. Great bathroom products and extremely clean! The bar and restaurant downstairs were buzzing for a Friday evening. Had a drink at the bar to get away from the abrupt thunderstorm and the manager even gave us a complimentary glass of champagne when he realised we were in-house guests. Cannot complain about anything until some noise coming from our room abruptly woke us up at 5am. They later explained it was the heating but it was so loud there was no way you could go back to sleep. Regardless of that true Hôtel itself was lovely as would consider it again as a go to hotel when in NY next.

Yes it is a bit awkward to enter the hotel as there is the bar and restaurant you have to walk through to get to the reception. In the evening it is very lively and crowed that might be bothersome but I kinda liked it. The staff is really nice and very friendly. Best thing for me was the room. I just loved it, made me feel at home and I enjoyed my stay. The heater was a bit noisy but that was not really that annoying.

The building was the former headquarters of "Life" magazine (hence the name). Per Wikipedia: "It is considered a building of "outstanding significance" by the New York Landmarks Preservation Commission." The rooms are quirky and cute - very B&B like. The one I stayed in was quite small, the super comfy queen sized bed took up almost all of the main room. The bathroom was decent sized and very nice, appointed with art-deco style fixtures. Everything was spotless. I actually booked 3 other rooms for coworkers (we were on a business trip), all of whom liked their rooms as well.Entering the hotel is interesting - you walk through a busy, vibrant bar/restaurant area to get to the little registration desk. There are two interestingly-designed elevators to take you up to your room (rounded back wall, old-timey floor indicators). The layout of the floors is unusual - it's not obvious where the rooms are, but you'll find them with a little exploration.The TV system is fantastic. I'm not a video junkie, but the menu system is pretty cool. The hot water is very, very hot - be careful. One thing I really liked is that all the lights are on dimmer switches. A very nice touch.The breakfast was very light - coffee (and probably tea, we didn't ask for it), a choice of a couple of types of croissant, a fruit cup, a coffee cake, a yogurt parfait, and a hard boiled egg cup. Not huge, but it gets you started. The coffee was good.Unfortunately, we didn't have an opportunity to try the restaurant, but it sure seemed popular.I only live a 3 hour drive north of the city, but I'll most likely stay here again when I have my next first-thing-in-the-morning meeting in the area.
