Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: This place is great Little expensive in AustralianDollars but affordable great central location Staff are great Very clean rooms small though Bed was comfortable Restaurant and bar were good If I get back to NYC I would love to stay here again

Just perfect for å group of friends. Very good beds - and light color. Love the elevator and the feeling of Henry restaurant on the ground floor made it a real New York hotel. Just love it. They also have a good fitnessroom.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The location was great and the room was comfortable. We really liked the floor that was partially uncovered wood. The bed was comfortable and the employees friendly and helpful. We also had a late dinner in the restaurant and it was delicious.

The pictures do not include the room that we stayed in... it was much smaller than expected. However- the staff was incredible. My boyfriend lost his wallet and the stewardist went out of her way to help, and gave us two complimentary cocktails! The bars playlist was great... and there was also great live music one afternoon!

Very cute boutique hotel. My room was tiny but perfect for just me for one night. I really liked the details of the bathroom (faucets and whatnot). The bathroom did smell a little moldy. Why does that happen?? Is it because they use shower curtains?? It seems like a newly refurbished room so I cannot imagine it is the bathroom itself. And it all looked clean. I’m gonna blame the shower curtain. Anyway, I’m a fan of old, historic buildings, so staying here was a treat for me. Checking in was fast and easy. One thing I did not appreciate was the fact that there is ANOTHER fee they charge you when you arrive (the app I booked from did not tell me about that. Not cool. The other hotel I stayed in later in the week did not do that).As others have commented, yes, the check-in counter is through a restaurant and it is nothing special. Just a box with one or two people behind it. I had a small bfast the next morning at their bar, the boy who attended me was very pleasant.

My husband and I spent two nights at The Life Hotel. This was not our first experience staying at this property. I checked in on opening night of the hotel and had a marvelous experience. After that initial visit, whenever I am in NYC, I check the rates at The Life and if it is affordable, it is my go to hotel. This recent trip found us there on a Thursday night and then checking back in on a Saturday. Both nights we enjoyed excellent service and a comfortable clean room. I will be returning for another night in March and I am certain it will be a perfect time.

I've been staying here since it was the pre-renovation Herald Square Hotel but hadn't returned for a few years. It's quirky with the narrow corridors and staircase around the lift shaft of an old NY office building (LIFE magazine) and the rooms have iron bedsteads and bare wood floors to match that look. Very comfortable beds, plenty of good towels, friendly helpful staff, fair rates for midtown, close to transportation. The bare floors in our room had not been vacuumed and we kept picking up bits of floor material on bare feet. The bathroom supplies and water bottles were not replenished for our 2nd night. The bathroom is adequate but TINY and on the 2nd day the extractor fan stopped working, so the mirrors were entirely steamed up and there was condensation on the tile floor. The hot water - boiling hot, and a good powerful shower - took almost 3 minutes to get from wherever the boiler is to the shower and sink. Free luggage storage before and after checking in/out, very convenient. Sad to report that the toilet was not cleaned after our first night's stay, very disappointing when the service was otherwise decent. Watch out for those additional fees and taxes that fatten the room rate.

A lovely hotel in a wonderfully historic building that has been renovated to a high standard. Rooms are surprisingly spacious for NYC standards and have nice modern/minimalist decor. The hotel's restaurant serves some amazing food and also has a lively, busy bar area. The hotel staff were all friendly and we liked the extra touches, such as a complimentary re-fillable water bottle. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again in the future.

Pretty easy to access via the D train and they gave us coupons for a free specialty drink of the day at the bar. That turned out to be red or white wine, but still a nice gesture. Watch out for rooms on the first floor - ours was super hot (in February) and the only thing we could do was turn on the air conditioning because the heat was coming from the floor. It was also possible to hear people in the bar from the room... not terrible or too loud, but not great.

The Life Hotel in Manhattan's NOMAD neighborhood boasts a very editorial past as it was the original headquarters of the lifestyle magazine called Life Magazine. In this turn of the 20th century building, the new owners of Life Hotel did some amazing upgrading using contemporary decor elements like modern furniture and lightening in guest rooms. Bathrooms are very tight but provide plush towels and better-than-average amenities. The restaurant and basement speakeasy are worth a visit -- overall, staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming.

Comfortable rooms, friendly and accommodating receptionist, great bar where we were given complimentary tickets for beer/wine. The bar didn’t feel like one you would usually find in a hotel; not at all stuffy, nice to sit around on tall stools to chew the fat with other guests and friendly bar staff; cocktails were good!

I don’t understand that boutique hotel consepts.The Life Hotel doesn’t have a proper lobby area. There is a restaurant in front of the hotel, no one around and you have to carry your luggages up to stairs, while chek-in you have to be standing. No room service, but the rooms neither have a kettle nor mini bar facilities. When you need a taxi, they advice you go and fetch one.I will never stay in such an hotel without proper facilities.

Room had a very individual character, very nice and clean, though they could have provided a hook to hang a coat :-) . Floors very cold during winter, no rugs. Hotel is very charming, everybody at the reception desk was very forthcoming, helpful and nice with the exception of the red-haired lady. She was simply not friednly (other guests complained about her, too). The housekeeping staff was very nice, too. Can recommend bar and restaurant. Location is great, everything you need is close by. Good starting point also for trips outside New York City.I would stay there again but am currently undecided because my request for a correction of the address on my invoice has still not been processed - after 11 days now. That's not exactly service-oriented customer treatment. But anyway - if you don't have that problem, I would certainly recommend it.

This boutique Hotel is a feel at home style hotel and Monica from front desk make shire of this and in my world she is if not the best in front desk assistants is in the top 3 knowledgeable of the history of the Hotel, kind and very professional representing the brand; is perfectly spotted in downtown walking distance from Empire State Building. It’s has a great restaurant with farm to table food and great price and for evening beer or spirits the bartenders are great and with some local mixes. Rooms are clean, bed is orthopedic and bathrooms are good only that the toilet is very close to the wall.

Simply a perfect little place to stay. Darling room, friendly staff and excellent location. Close to the subway, restaurants and places we wanted to be. Glad we picked this hotel! Staff was able to give restaurant recommendations. We enjoyed meeting friends in the bar, great vibe. Thanks for having us!

The hotel was very central to everything and convenient to restaurants. Walking in to the hotel can be tricky when the restaurant patrons are waiting for a table, but nothing super terrible. We were promised an upgrade to the double queen with private balcony, but didn't score the balcony afterall. When I called the front desk, the woman said she was sorry but that room was already taken. She said she would "make it up" to me, but nothing materialized. Even when I asked about breakfast, it didn't dawn on the woman to offer free vouchers. I did manage to walk away with two gratis bottles of water, so I guess I WIN! hahaha Anyway, super clean, very comfy, albeit sparse rooms (no rug, one chair, small console table). Loved the shower. HUGE tv (for some reason). No fan in bathroom, but surprisingly no visible mold/mildew.

Very clean, great staff, great location!! The bar was great and busy, the rooms were very clean, spacious for NYC and the bathroom was updated and very clean. The location was very convenient to all major attractions. Would definitely stay again!

We were really impressed with our stay at the Life Hotel. Check-in was smooth - our room was ready early. The room itself was clean, quirky and modern, plus plenty of space for a NY hotel. You access the reception through the bar in the hotel and the bar/restaurant was lively and fun. We would have eaten there if we'd been staying longer. On the day we checked out, the water was off. This happens a lot in NY in our experience. Initially when we rang down we were told quite abruptly that it would be on in 5 minutes. 45 minutes later I rang back and got the same message again. This was frustrating seeing as we were checking out that morning and needed to have showers. The water did come back on and the staff at checkout offered us a voucher by way of apology, even before I had chance to complain, which was nice. The area immediately surrounding the hotel is nothing special but it's bang in the centre of the city - walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, Times Square and many others so I would definitely return here! I thought it was great value for where it was and for the type of room.

Decent midtown accommodation. Was supposed to be there two nights for a quick NYC weekend but was forced to stay one night due to storm in NYC region the day off my arrival and my flight was cancelled. Flew in next day... Hotel would not refund. I understand, but would have been nice for them to accommodate. No points taken off for this.Great location, not far from things but also not in the mess of Times Square.Friends traveling with me... Their room wasn't ready when they arrived. Staff would not check them in until room was ready, seems kind of odd. Front desk staff was only so-so... But house keeping and maintenance team were great!Would stay again.

I knew i was getting a standard room upon booking on hoteltonight but upon checking in i asked if there were any upgrades i can pay for. I was met with an abrupt no and that there was nothing available. This was deeply upsetting because when i had checked the website after checking in, i noticed that there were HIGHER categories available within the hotel. Why was i told no when YOUR website clearly stated that there was rooms available? The rooms itself was tidy, bathroom was actually pretty spacious for a standard room. The bar and restaurant was lively and happening.

I had made the reservation early in the morning. Had a friend check in first which was fine. Then when i arrive at the hotel, the receptionist was incompetent. I gave her my I.D. and asked for a duplicate key and she refused and gave me a hard time. She barely spoke English and it was just frustrating overall. How do you decline a paying guest a key to the room they paid for? The room was tiny! Never again!

Good location in Midtown but away from the hustle and bustle of tourist spots - the room was slightly small but perfect for our needs, decorated nicely and had a beautiful king size bed! Very close to Penn Station and there was a restaurant & bar downstairs if needed. Check in and check out was made simple and we were able to store our bags each time. Would definitely stay here again if we were looking for a place in Midtown. Only issue I had is that I am still waiting on a response from the property regarding a charge on my card.

The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring NYC. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable of the local area. The room was clean, modern and spacious with a mini fridge and safe. Luggage storage is available both before and after check in and there is also free tea, coffee and ice available 24/7.

Kathleen [-] is a nightmare of a person to deal with. She is unapologetic and extremely UK professional, gets back to you a week later talks like an uneducated gangster, rude and talks over you. Its shocking that a person like this is in a management position

really nice hotel......less noise in rooms in back of hotel....front rooms have some street noise...nice bar on first floor...great location right where you need to be in midtown, cloe to penn station and madison square gardens

We stayed for a "girls trip" (mom and 2 teenagers). Chose a premium room, king bed with sleeper sofa, and had plenty of space. Everything felt posh and comfortable to us. Staff was outstanding, including those at Henry bar and restaurant. The location was great for hopping on subway trains at Herald Square. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends!

This is a fun, centrally located boutique hotel. The rooms are small, but if you're like me, you don't spend much time in your room - especially in NYC. There was a small desk - suitable for an hour or two of managing emails, but not much more. This is NOT an extended stay kind of place. More than three nights and you'll notice the tight quarters. Others have mentioned street noise - it was there, but didn't keep me from sleeping. Frankly, I've been in high rise, Times Square big chain hotels and heard plenty of street noise - some of which would have kept some people up. You're staying in NYC - if street noise will affect your sleep, I don't know much that will help you. I enjoyed the hotel and bar staff, and would definitely return for another two or three night stay

As mentioned in many other reviews, Reception is at the rear of the restaurant and wasn’t immediately obvious to us as the place was pretty busy. Things got off to a shaky start with us being asked to move out of the way as we checked in. This was in case any of the restaurantguests wanted to get past in order to use the toilets. (We were spending nearly $3000.00 here and I wasn’t overly impressed with the attitude of this member of staff). Check in was otherwise uneventful and we set off upstairs to check out the rooms. We had a double Queen and a single queen room. Both rooms were big enough for our needs with super comfy beds and large screen TVs. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There was no carpet in the single queen room which we thought was a bit odd - just a painted concrete floor. It doesn’t feel very clean to walk on and if I owned the hotel it would be the first thing I would do. We found the staff to be generally on the surly side which surprised us as they are widely praised on here. The lady that checked us out was definitely the exception as she was lovely. When we checked in we were given vouchers for free cocktails in with our room keys to welcome us, however, we weren’t told that they were there and didn’t find them until the day we were checking out. My personal feeling is that a welcome gesture like this really can set the tone for an entire stay so to not tell guests that the vouchers are there is massively missing a trick. The lovely lady on Reception explained that we could still use them after check out and saved the day again!Our experience here overall was very positive but more because of the hotel and its superb location rather than the staff. We cant comment on food here as we didn’t eat here - again, if the staff gave a more welcoming vibe then we may have chosen to do so. The coffee machine on the second floor is fine - hot chocolate was very good. There is a small gym which looked decent enough. They were accommodating with looking after our suitcases after checkout while we went shopping and we had our welcome cocktails before we left. I also had a couple of G&Ts which were incredibly expensive - its not a cheap bar but it does have a great atmosphere.

I hate to write a disappointing review, as I really liked the staff here, but I have to be honest and say that this wasn't the experience I hoped for. I stayed for 4 nights during a business trip. The location is great - super central; close to several subway lines and easy to walk to many things both uptown and downtown. The font desk and staff in general were lovely - so friendly and wanting to help. That's where the fun stops. The room itself is minuscule and very poorly designed. I asked to moved to a larger room, and they did help me do so on my second night, but the "upgrade" was negligible - hardly worth the trouble. The issue is that the designer made poor furniture choices of shoving giant king size beds inside a small space, and in my "bigger" room, they decided to add a couch at the foot of the bed. So where there was finally a few extra feet of space, it was a waste to put additional furniture there! Fine linens and a big bed don't make up for a room you can barely walk in. The bed takes up the ENTIRE room, and I'm not exaggerating. My suite case sat in front of the door which has a few inches of space between it and the bed, and when I had to go out, I'd put it in the bathroom! The bathroom has ZERO counter space. For real - ZERO. They have a cheap mesh staking shelf under the sink that you can use to hold toiletries, but who wants to put their toothbrush on a bathroom floor - even if it is on a baby shelf - that's gross. The heater/AC unit is a window unit that is SOOOO loud, I chose to turn it off to sleep and froze to death. Luckily there was a Nordstrom Rack nearby where I bought sweats and socks to sleep in. The closet holds about 3 outfits. If you are there for more than a couple of nights, definitely don't stay here. Lastly, on top of the window unit, I had a front facing room when they moved me and OMG - the noise was crazy. I didn't sleep a wink! Trucks and people and honking horns, oh my. Plus, you hear everyone in every room that is near you and in the hallways. I also had a room near the elevator which is never fun, but especially loud here. Also, as noted in other reviews - no lobby at all - you walk into a loud restaurant. Overall, it's just not a great design, and it's obvious they worked hard to make it "hip and cool", but it misses the mark. For the price, given it's NYC, it's "okay", but you can spend a little more (e.g. $50 or so per night) and get an exponentially better hotel.

I arrived at the Life hotel only to find out that my confirmed reservation from @Expedia was not in their system and they were fully booked. I was not notified of this by Expedia prior to my travels otherwise I could have made my own alternative accommodations before arriving. Immediately contacted Expedia lodgings number and was redirected to the travel relocation agent. The Expedia agent was unprofessional, incompetent, incoherent, and disrespectful of my time. The agent offered to book me an alternate hotel room but after 2.5 hours, was unable provide me with anything but empty promises.The resolution was only achieved between the Life hotel and myself without the assistance of the Expedia agent. The hotel had one of the guests cancel during the 2.5 hours of my wait time on the phone with Expedia, and graciously offered the room to us.The hotel staff were a holiday life-saver and was gracious, positive, accommodating, welcoming, and very helpful (even while we were waiting, they were gracious hosts). I am very thankful that things worked out in the end. The hotel is very central and convenient to many tourist locations in the city. Only a few minutes walk to Macy’s, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Korea town, etc. It was clean, modernized and the room was a good size for a downtown location. The beds were soft, had a huge in-room TV, a safe, and the washroom was in good shape. The staff were friendly, full of smiles, professional and very understanding. Thanks for letting us stay with you and happy holidays.

I liked a lot about the hotel. The decor, position & friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were super small and we had 3 big bags which took over the room. Super comfy beds and great bath and shower though!!!

Just spent 2 nights at this hotel. Wonderful place, close to sightseeing hot spots. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Rooms were terrific, the bed comfy and the bathroom very spacious. Love our stay and would definitely come back here.

Great clean hotel near everything! We really liked the Life hotel very convenient location, the room was small but typical for NYC. Staff was very friendly and we liked the vibe. Would definitely return on our next visit to the Big Apple.

We recently returned from a three night stay at the Life Hotel. We couldn’t have loved it more. Yes, it isn’t the quietest hotel in the world but given the location - right around the corner from Penn Station, MSG and the Empire State - you expect that there will be some outside noise. If visiting for touristy reasons, the location will be a huge benefit to you. Subway station a minute round the corner that will take you downtown and the the Lower East side. Open top bus stop essentially at the end of the street. 5 or so avenues up from the port where you can get a New York ferry over to Brooklyn. We stayed in room 602 which was a really good size with plenty of space for cases, a sofa and a huge comfy bed. The rooms are simple and stylish but equipped with all the things I want when staying in a hotel that I don’t expect to be spending a lot of time in (ie. in a place like NYC) such as a great bed, a hot shower and a decent TV. The rooms have all of these things. My only slight wish would have been for tea/coffee making facilities in the room. There is a machine on the second floor though and the coffee from it was actually really nice. I’ve also read some poor comments about customer service but my experience with the front desk was fantastic. We also received a couple of drinks tokens for a free cocktail when we checked in (the bar is excellent - not usually a lover of a Tom Collins but the ones we had were fantastic) Everyone we encountered was lovely and very helpful in terms of advice and directions. We really enjoyed our stay and have already decided that when we return to NYC in the summer that this will be our base. Give it a try, you won’t be disappointed.

Loved our stay at The Life Hotel, the rooms were stylish, the shower was hot and the bed was huge and very comfortable. We opted for the King with sofa room and there was plenty of space. No pretentions, low key, amazing food served downstairs in the restaurant, busy fun bar, perfect location. No room service or tea making facilities were the only minus point, otherwise all fantastic, would definitely stay here again.

Steyning, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Good location as near to train station (Penn station). Room condition can be better at least lays carpet on the floor instead of cement finishing. Coffee machine with hot chocolate options but not working. Nice and Big smart TV in the room. Air conditioner quite noisy when operating.

This is probably one of the worst hotels at this price range. I don't even know where to start! 1) Sewer smell the moment we walk in the room 2) No windows. Very dark. 3) SO loud throughout the day and even worse at night. I'm a very heavy sleeper, but even I woke up at least 6 times during the night. It's not the average motor/HVAC noise that's coming from right outside the blocked off window. I felt like I was staying at a car manufacturing factory. It gets very high pitched from 12am - 4am. The worst. 4) The doors are so thin and I was able to hear everyone's conversation in the hallway. 5) There is no lobby. You enter the building, and you're in middle of a restaurant. You go to the very back of it and you see a tiny reception desk. Very loud too. 6) Tiny. Hallways are narrow, elevators are small, the room is tiny. Suffocating overall. And I've been to numerous hotels in NYC so no, this isn't just a NY thing. 7) This hotel is like a poorly flipped house with a 10k budget. Only cosmestic work done. Worst $700 spent on two nights. Not even cheap!!!

I am so disappointed of all the places we stayed in NYC it was this one! Deceived by beautiful website and reviews. There is NO service— you can’t even book a cab with the receptionist. No room service, no coffee. The Christmas decorations look like they ran down to a Wal-Greens and just threw up everywhere. $549 for a room that was decorated like the dollar general for Christmas. Not kid friendly! So disappointed — price per room should be under $300!!! Don’t overpay like we did

Stayed for one night and loved the hotel. The room was comfortable, bathroom was spacious and the staff were so friendly and helpful. The restaurant in the lobby is great too. The only minus is the lack of tea/coffee in the bedroom as I really wanted one first thing! But they provide free bottles of water, which a lot of NY hotels do not...

I have never been more betrayed by other people’s reviews before, and I regularly travel for business all around the world. I can only assume the 2-3 staff they have spend all their downtime writing reviews for the hotel. The location is interesting - close to MSG and a few doors down from what must be a trash processing plant. There are good bars and restaurant very close. There is no lobby, it’s a restaurant. We waited for 20 minutes to checkin when there were only 2 people ahead of us (all the time being bumped and jostled by bar patrons trying to get to the bathroom).Our room was on the ground floor just past the public bathroom, with a window that looked at ducts (see photo) - I can’t believe they have the gall to rent out that room. It did give me nostalgia for my old rent controlled apartment on the upper west side - large heavy old doors, a good sized bathroom and a comfortable bed (that made so much noise when you moved you could hear everything your neighbor was doing). You couldn’t control the heat and it was sweltering - we had to plug in and use the very loud in wall AC unit (in December). The front desk staff was completely rude and couldn’t be bothered. They banged loudly on our door 10 minutes after hotel checkout time - rude and strange for a hotel in the US. The free coffee on the second floor is in a hallway and is just a machine with no milk or cream for coffee. Gym is tiny.Extremely disappointed and would never consider returning.

Very Nice Hotel, is super clean en the bar downstairs is also Great, nearby the hotspots of New York, bathroom is very small we went here with familie and we had 2 rooms. For 4 days iT is fine to stay

Love the history behind this hotel - would definitely recommend reading up about it ahead of your stay as it makes it all the more special. The rooms are stunning with cute little fixtures and accents, beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are great too. The price given the location and quality is good as well. Would definitely stay here again.

I spent 3 nights at LIFE Hotel (room 507).It was a very nice hotel experience in the center of New York. The hotel is fresh renovated and everything looks nice. The room was small, but really cosy and very well clean!Internet connection was good and the location just PERFECT, near to subway, restaurants, bars etc.The service provided at reception (checkin) during the week was extraordinary kind and professional. However, the service at reception during night and on Saturday for checkout was kind of insufficient, i.e. impersonal approach, not professional and no smile! Generally speaking a very nice and clean hotel in the centre of Manhattan!

This hotel has been a favourite of mine when I’m in NYC for work. It’s also been visited by a number of my colleagues on my recommendation. My latest visit was terrible however, and I will not be going back. Ever. Reception charged me twice for the hotel, sent me over my credit card limit and my cards got blocked by my UK bank. I couldn’t access any money the Sunday I was in New York. Which was extremely stressful, time consuming and expensive to sort out. On the Monday I stayed, the hotel had no water, so I wasn’t able to shower before a very long and important day at work.I understand that both of these things are unfortunate and can happen, but the service I have received since has been awful.I have been given $100 off my total bill and that doesn’t even cover a fraction of the inconvenience they caused me and definitely doesn’t cover the phone calls I had to make to my bank back home. The staff just don’t care. The assistant GM Jaymes was fairly helpful the day I had no money but I was passed on to another manager called Kathleen when he was off and the emails I have sent since are being ignored by her. She was extremely rude during my stay and made me feel very small and my calls since are never answered. I’m so disappointed.

I stayed in the Life Hotel with my daughter and her friend. We had a queen twin bed room. Beds were super comfy. The room ( on the 7 th floor) was quiet with very little traffic noise. It was spotlessly clean. The location was suburb. Away from the crowds and noise in Times square but still very central. Two blocks from the Empire State Building and a 3 minute walk to the subway. It felt very safe to walk around , even later in the evening. Staff were friendly and helpful both in the hotel and the bar/ restaurant. We would definitely return and found it to be good value for money. The only downside was a noisy heater/cooling unit which we turned off overnight and a tiny closet - definitely not enough room for 3 girls! But really these things were just minor.

This is the only hotel I stay at NYCGreat service, housekeeping and staffVery quiet on my floor anywayVery chicGreat vibe in bar and restaurant tooLocation is near everything and in a developing area as wellI’ll be back again!

The hotel is located perfectly for those who want to get around lower Manhattan without necessarily having to use public transport or taxi. The hotel itself was very nice, the premium king room was spacious for New York standards. The bed was huuuge and so comfortable! We did find the bed sheets a bit annoying though, as it wasn’t a duvet cover but simply a sheet, a duvet, and another sheet on top. We got a bit tangled up while sleeping but not a major issue.We stayed 4 nights and when the cleaners did our room they didn’t always refill the shower gel or the water bottles, which is minor but was a bit annoying when showering or when really thirsty (and tangled up) in the middle of the night. Advice for those who have cold feet: take warm slippers, the floor is really cold! Also there was a plumbing issue on the last day which made showering very difficult (cold water and very low pressure). We understand it was a problem with the whole building, but it was a bit annoying on the morning of our departure. Would have appreciated a kind gesture from management, which sadly didn’t happen!Overall we really enjoyed our stay and we would definitely recommend and book again for our next NY trip!

Stayed for the night while in the city. Hotel was very accommodating, check in and out was very quick and flawless. Hotel is on the older side since it was the old Life Magazine building, but that only adds to the charm. Room was on the smaller side but they all are in the city. Plenty of room for two people for the night. Bed was extremely comfortable Large flat screen TV at the foot of the bed with plenty of channel choices. Room was quiet except for an occasional siren going by, not a big deal. Bar & restaurant downstairs were always busy and an added plus while staying here. You do get a complimentary drink voucher per guest when you check in and they have free Wi-Fi as well.

The hotel was great! The rooms were clean & well equipped. I LOVED the quotes above the beds! Only downside I is the restaurant menu. Didn't like a thing on it, therefore I didn't eat one meal there. Might try to include items most folks would like

This hotel is in a great location just around the corner from Penn Station. The hotel itself looks good and the rooms are large a comfortable with great beds, a small fridge, table and very small cupboard. The WiFi in the building is also quick and reliable. The staff are friendly and helpful. Negatively the surrounding area is unbelievably noisy and the thin windows (the one is our room didn’t actually close right because it was slightly broken) do little to block out the street and constant construction noise. We also had an issue with the plumbing in our room with our toilet not filling properly, the sink not draining and the hot water in the shower sometimes being pretty patchy. Overall we had a good stay at the hotel but for the price I would have expected a few more of the small imperfections to have been addressed. That being said were I to stay again on a similar budget I would look again at this place.

Upside: the rooms were comfortable, attractive and generously sized for NYC, and the location is great. Lively atmosphere in the lobby bar and restaurant downstairs, which always felt welcoming. Downside: staff generally friendly and helpful, although it took repeated complaints about a significant issue in one of the 2 rooms we booked, for some appropriate action to take place. Jaymes, one of the managers, was the most helpful.

The Life hotel is well located and close to most attractions. This is my second time staying there and I enjoyed it. The bed is comfortable, the room is a bit slow but the bathroom is nice. You receive a coupon for a welcome drink which is very much appreciated even if it is part of their "experience" fee. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a quick stay in a clean and well located hotel in New York city.

Thoroughly enjoyed the stay I experienced here for a weekend in October. I arrived to NY rather last moment and had no clue where I might stay. It just so happened that I was in this hotel's neighborhood when I began my hotel search. It was a great find and I hope to return. Fun bar inside too!

The art above the bed consisted of a handwritten note, "Of course I talk to myself. I consider myself a good speaker and I appreciate an intelligent audience." I can relate to that sentiment. Anyway, if you're looking for a central location at a good price in Manhattan, I can heartily recommend this renovated boutique hotel on 31st between 5th and Broadway. It's not a coincidence that it's called Life as the classic glossy magazine was published in this building from the time it was built in 1895 until 1936. There is a classic vintage feel to its architectural elements beginning with the ornate front awning.It was originally designed by the same architects who designed the New York Public Library on 42nd Street. However, the rooms feel quite contemporary with high ceilings, wood floors, and one of the bigger TV screens I've ever seen in a hotel room. For a room with a queen bed, it was $290 per night, a reasonable rate for Midtown. We even took advantage of their second-floor workout room to shave off some of the calories we gathered on our brief vacation in the Big Apple. Alas, as with many period office buildings, the lobby is cramped, but there is a nice long bar (photo) and a stellar new restaurant called Henry.

Just spent 2 nights at Life Hotel in a Premium King room...Pros:- the staff was very, very nice. Genuinely friendly and helpful- the design is great: white on white with accents in the rooms, matte brass & hexagon fixtures in the bathrooms, modern fresh feel throughout- lobby and bar were very 'boutique hotel' and convenient- the bathroom was spacious for NYC and well appointed with plenty of good quality towels- the sheets were comfortable and soft- good size TV with plenty of channelsCons:- the bed king was awful! Lumpy with uncomfortable dips and no spring in the coils. Clearly the mattresses had not been replaced or even flipped over in *some* time. The bed frame was noisy and it woke the other person up when moving or going to the bathroom at night- took 3 showers and all of them were bad. The first 2 showers the water temp would suddenly go from normal to freezing to scalding with no indication which made for a somewhat perilous experience. The last shower I took the temp would not go above tepid/cold lukewarm (at best)- tiny, lone window made for a dark room even though it was white on white decor and our room was on a higher floor- didn't feel like I got my money's worth at $325 a night, even for NYC. Life Hotel really should prioritize comfortable and quality mattresses and hot water in the bathrooms over aesthetics.

Loved this hotel . We had a family room with 2 big , comfy beds . The bathroom was really nice with nice bath products . The bar and restaurant always had people in it , had a good vibe . Perfect location for shopping , round the corner from Macy’s . The decor of the room , from beds , to lighting , to bathroom was really tastful and not like a standard hotel .

I love this hotel, the staff, housekeeping. Makes me feel like home. I come multiple times of year and never stay at my typical Hilton in NYC anymore. I haven’t since Life began what 2 years ago now?!The restaurant has wonderful food...eclectic Pan African I would call it. The Rice, the simple life breakfast, the potstickers, the chicken is to die for, the ham/egg/cheese on biscuit is wonderful. ROTI is fun with the multiple condiments See you in November!

Good midtown location close to the Empire State but not too busy. Staff are very welcoming & helpful plus you get a free drink in the bar. There is a small gym on floor 2 and complimentary coffee machine opposite. We did not try the restaurant but this and the bar were very popular in the evening. Our room (802) was spacious for NYC with a very comfy bed, good shower and a bit of a view to the south. It would have benefitted from a chest of drawers and the sofa bed had to be made up for our son. The lift is slow but the stairs seemed to work! Overall excellent value if you can get it (£200/night for all 3 of us in October half term week after all taxes/fees were paid). You can get a healthy lunch at Speedy’s round the corner (near 34th Street subway, 28th Street subway is slightly closer but make sure you enter the correct side for your route) and we enjoyed excellent breakfasts at Friedman’s, a couple of blocks west along 31st Street, who cater well for dietary requirements including gluten free. Overall I recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal.

Book into this hotel for 4 nights and was very impressed from the first minute there. A unique hotel which at first glance looks dated but was extremely comfortable and clean. Our room was excellent with a huge bathroom and deep bath, bed was very large and extremely comfortable, only downside was no tea or coffee making facilities in room, you had to go to a machine on 2nd floor (a bit of a pain first thing in morning, having to get dressed before having a drink). We did not use the restaurant as was always busy except breakfast time, but then they do not really do a breakfast menu. Bar was very friendly, always busy but a bit on the expensive side, but then again nearly everywhere is. All in all a great place to base yourself if doing the tourist bit in New York.

I was attracted by the decor of this hotel and in that way it did not disappoint. The staff are also very friendly and helpful.However a few words of warning. Space - there is not a lot. Yes, to be expected in NYC but if you’re hoping for drawer space for your clothes, don’t stay here, they don’t have it.Noise - the walls are paper thin. My sleep was interrupted every day by noise in the corridor, neighbouring rooms and chattering housekeepers. The 1 inch gap under my door did not help matters.I tried politely to explain these difficulties and wanted to move hotels, but the management would not make an exception to refund the pre-paid remainder of my stay. I understand why, but this is a shame nonetheless.Perhaps better suited to the leisure traveller. But business travellers beware.

+ Great location. Nice bathroom (recently refurbished and size). Great bed and TV.- Room not cleaned every day. Cold at night and heating too noisy to leave it for long. No hot water at certain times. Promised a quiet room but given a noisy one (might be temporary but works on the street started before 5am). Feeling of not being taken seriously when making requests (and I don't think I am particularly fussy).

I loved this hotel. Really fun bar and restaurant in the lobby. The rooms are a bit on the smaller side, but a big bed and great atmosphere is all I wanted. Lots of gold accents and funky decor. Staff was super friendly. Would definitely stay again.

We were three sisters and our mum travelling to New York for 14 days.We had rooms 811 and 1001.Life Hotel was the perfect location for us - close to subway stations, Broadway, 5th and 6th Avenues, only 10mins walk to Times Square or further downtown. After exploring so much of the city, we all agreed this was the best location.The beds were the most comfortable we’ve ever slept in - all four of us commented on them! Room 1001 was wonderful - large and great natural light and a really nice space for us to retreat after a full day’s walking. Room 811 while comfortable did feel much darker in the day and that is because it was tucked away at the back and had just a small window. The benefit of that was that we slept beautifully - no light or noise to disturb us. All the staff were very friendly and obliging. Housekeeping standards were very high and it was always nice to come back to such clean rooms.The only issues we had were the showers being a bit temperamental with temperature - the staff were quick to address it when we did mention it, but I also see that being an old building, there are probably plumbing issues that are hard to rectify. It wouldn’t put me off staying there again. The restaurant downstairs is very hip and happening - every single night had a crowd and great music. If you were on the lower levels of the hotel, this may have affected the noise in those rooms although I couldn't say for sure as we were on the upper levels. My sister celebrated her birthday while there and Jaymes kindly organised a delicious cake that was delivered to her room as a surprise.I loved everything about Life Hotel. The location is awesome, the vibe is wonderful and the staff are all very friendly.We all loved New York more than we could have hoped and having a lovely place to retreat each day absolutely topped the stay off.I'd highly recommend this location and boutique hotel.

Barely any rooom in our room. Very difficult finding space for the suitcase. But the worst was the absence of windows both in the bedroom and the bathroom, we had to guess at the weather every day! When I cmplained to the woman at the desk, she came back at me with a very snarky attitude implying that all the rooms were windowless. Our stay was for four nights at the beginning of October 1918. Never again!!!

We enjoyed our stay at the Life Hotel- loved the style, good service and close to everything as you’re midtown to everything!Cute restaurant and bar below- only thing is there isn’t a separate entrance to hotel bit so anyone could acess floors or rooms

Ok so you’re not getting the works here when it comes to this hotel. Location is perfect in midtown right by Penn Station. The room is small, basically walk in bed small closet, don’t expect to fit huge suitcase anywhere. Bathroom is decent size. Decor is nicely laid out and modern. And I liked the lighting over the bed. Hallways are dark and dated. Bar in lobby is small but nice drinks. If you want somewhere central that is cozy I recommend.

Loved the boutique feel of the hotel. Very comfortable bed, good bathroom. Location is excellent for walking to many areas. Did eat in the restaurant I would recommend it. AC is very noisy but this drowns out the street noise so was fine. Only reason it doesn’t get 5/5 is we got stuck in the elevator and assistance from the staff at the time was zero. Manager recompensed next day. I would stay again.

Midtown location awesome (close to Empire State Building, Madison Park, Broadway, MSG), room and bathroom both super clean and stylish decor, and staff friendly. Love the artwork as well, red and white posters with inspirational sayings. Really cool wine and chocolate bar right next door as well as an Asian restaurant with delicious dollar oysters during happy hour. (Restaurant in the hotel lobby still getting going.)

Check in is and easy and the bar/restaurant was fantastic. I couldn’t reach the AC unit to turn it up because it was really humid but other than that I really enjoyed the stay. The bed was big and comfy.

The room was very clean. The bathroom was super clean with everything you could possibly need. It was raining very hard when we arrived. My friend’s coat was dripping wet. We called the desk and someone picked up the coat returning it dry a half hour later. The coffee machine on the second floor was wonderful. My favorite beverage is coffee. Cocoa and tea were available as well. The room was also very quiet. I have stayed in New York when the street noise was so loud that getting to sleep was almost impossible. The only thing lacking was a mat in the shower.

Returned again this year but just for 3 nights before sailing back to the UK ! Greeting at reception was warm and friendly and check in was quick. Nice to be remembered from previous stay. Room was as good as the one we had last year when we stayed 9 nights. Comfortable bed, great shower and bathroom. The roomWas on the small side but your find this in many NYC hotels. How much time do you spend in your room! Location is central just around the corner from Macey’s and the metro. Easy walking distance to Empire State Building , and other local attractions . I look forward to returning again soon

I've stayed at the Life Hotel three times now on business trips, and it really fits the bill for my needs. The location on 31st Street between 5th and 6th Avenue is pretty much in the middle of mid-town and downtown, the two places I tend to have meetings. Even though the neighborhood in Koreatown is a bit charmless, it's just a couple of blocks south to the more on-trend Chelsea and it's restaurants and bars. The hotel is recently renovated, rooms are attractive and comfortable and everything tends to work quite well. We noticed the restaurant and bar downstairs just changed hands and it's fantastic in its current iteration, very elevated multi-cultural cuisine. It gets busy at night with outsiders, and has a nice vibe. Service is exceptional. Breakfast is delicious but very expensive with small portions. I only did it once because of the high prices, and did takeout from Pret-a-Manger on the other two days. I think they should rethink the breakfast because the dining room was quite empty on all three days. All around, the Life Hotel is great value for what you get. It's my new go-to hotel for business trips.

Staff was very professional, helpful, responsive. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable, but could use a coffee maker. Good location. Uber rides were not too expensive to get us to the theater district, and to the lower east side for a foodie tour.

Rooms small, King Size bed too big for the room. Air shaft window. Bathroom large and good design. Front desk staff responsive and helpful. Modern lighting. Large (65 inches? ) TV. Korea town neighborhood close to all lower Broadway shops and Union Sq restaurants. Recommend for the value price

The hotel's location makes it easy to get virtually anywhere in NYC. The hotel's website and room photos suggest a level of stylishness that is...maybe missing from the building's exterior, but you find it when you open your door to your room. It's an old school building with a traditional/Euro feel (for example, tiny check in desk and elevator), so as long as you don't need a grand lobby to lounge in and modern amenities like room service or in-room mini bar and snacks, then I'd recommend it! Our room was quite large by NYC standards and I was surprised that it included a giant screen tv. (Not sure who is watching tv when visiting NYC.) I love the style of the fixtures and other decor, but would note that our bed was squeaky/noisy, if that is a concern for you.

Took my husband to eat at Henry because we LOVE CHEF JJ and then decided to stay the night in manahattan instead heading back to Yonkers! It was a surprise for my husbands birthday! The room was super chic, cozy and clean. Great hotel, restaurant and bar! Will stay again!

You can't beat the location in Midtown, situated between two Subway lines providing convenient access to all the different routes, depending on where exactly you want to go. This is a lovely historic building with high ceilings, wood flooring and a boutique-ish feel. The bed was very comfortable, staff was always very friendly, wifi was fast, HDTV screen was very big (w/ Dish network), and all day/night the room was QUIET. Would definitely stay here again!

Very good hotel, clean room, excellent location and good service. My girlfriend and I had excellent time with our stay at the Life Hotel. The hotel has tons of style and the decor is really nice and modern. Huge tv and plenty of channels, bath and shower available. The hotel exceeded my expectations.

Excellent location !By foot: 2 mins to empire st. Building, 10 mins to time square, 10 mins to flat iron, 15/20 min grand central/librairy, 20/25 mins to rockfeller + st patrick church ...Room is little but cleanCoffe/tea freeBathroom is goodTV is huge

We were treated so well. Thank you Life Hotel for a great stay. The staff made sure everything was perfect for us and the other guests in our party. I definitely would recommend the hotel, bar, and restaurant.

The location is within 2 blocks of two subway lines, as well as the Empire State Building. The staff was polite and helpful. It was nice that they provide free filtered water and fresh coffee/tea round the clock. The only negative was that our room appeared to be a smoking room, being that it smelled of old smoke, but we arrived late so I didn’t bother bringing it to the attendants attention.Our party really enjoyed the location and charm of this hotel; would definitely stay here again.

I love boutique hotels and I love them in convenient nooks and crannies. The Life Hotel definitely fits into that category. The staff is very helpful. I usually stay in the midtown area, but this was a purely pleasure trip and the easy access to the subway, downtown, or midtown made this very convenient. Located between 5th and Broadway, you are close to everything without being too close to Times Square and the overcrowded tourist spots. Four of us stayed in one room (family) and we made it just fine. The bathroom was large and spacious with marble tile. Bed was comfortable. The downstairs restaurant and bar were excellent as well.

Nice boutique hotel. Decent workout room, free coffee machine, but he elevator is small and slow if you have a upper floor room. Good people working there. The bar makes a good old fashion. My only complaint is that the a/c units are loud, I’m a light sleeper.

Life hotel is a lovely hotel: beautiful rooms and bathrooms, great quality for price, well located, newly renovated, nice lobby with bar and all very clean! we'll definitely be back! Complimentary breakfast location (next to gym and elevators) could be improved... why not at the bar in the lobby :) ?

The staff was very courteous and accommodating. The incredible view from our balcony room 1007. Stay here every time we visit the city. Scored great tickets at the TKS at the Lincoln Center to see Anastasia.

I had a very good experience at this hotel. The room was clean, restroom was clean, both appeared to be recently renovated, the bed was very comfortable and clean. The room is small, typical for most NYC hotels, but who stays in the room while visiting NYC? Good location, close to the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. The front desk staff were very helpful. I would definitely consider staying here again if I ever make it back to the city.

Love the location we could walk to Rockefeller center and the hotel was cleanly and beautiful. There are quiet rooms available in the back of the hotel if you ask for them. We slept peacefully and weren't disturbed at all

Room was always clean, and it was surprisingly large for NYC! Admittedly, we had the king + sofa, but I'm used to smaller king rooms. The bed was super comfy, and the two of us never felt cramped for space. The bathroom was seriously huge. We were located right in the middle of everything and very close to great food and shops with easy access to everything else. I will definitely stay here again. Note: no minibar, if that kind of thing matters to you, but there is a fridge, which came in handy during our 3-night stay.

My room was well designed and cleanIt was a great value for New York.I got a better rate by calling, the website is out of date.The Henry has a new Chef and it was a soft opening.Food was amazing! Great service too!Unfortunately it was not open for breakfast or lunch or Sunday supper.

Kbindall
New York City, New York

review_body: 29 years old, traveling with a friend, want to be close to the center of the city but not pay crazy prices, still wanting a nice hotel. That was my criteria and Life Hotel was perfect. Incredibly friendly staff, easy check in experience, very clean rooms, modern yet old school vibe...classy throughout. I recommend this place and will be back. It’s in the heart of K-Town which makes it even that much more fun. And 24/7 hot coffee was a huge plus!

Super comfortable bed and friendly staff. Excellent base for experiencing all NYC has to offer! Walking distance to Empire State, Rockefeller Place and Times Square - train station close by for all others attractions. Would stay again, thank you Life.

We stayed for 4 nights at Life Hotel. We had received a room upgrade thanks to being an Expedia Gold member which was a very nice surprise. We had been delayed on our way to the hotel so didn’t check in until nearly midnight. I emailed them in advance and they got back to me very quickly to let me know that it wouldn’t be an issue. The room was large by any hotel’s standards and had the largest and most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept on. To be honest it was so comfy there were times I considered spending the entire 4 days in it. The bathroom was small but quite frankly I’ve never seen the point in a huge bathroom or understood the need for one. It did have a bath which was much needed after a day of walking around NYC in the heatwave. Morning coffee and pastries were good and it’s a nice touch. The hotel is conveniently located a couple of blocks south of the Empire State and a couple of blocks East of Penn station for your trip back to the airport. At worst it felt a bit impersonal but it’s New York, what do you expect.

Room 1003 was spacey and bright. Loved the natural light and minimalist feel. Had enough space to put our suitcases. Bed was more on the softer side but very comfy and felt bigger than a usual king size bed. Bathroom was good. Well lit! Plenty of towels and washcloths too which is s very nice touch. Best of all was the great functioning A/C since it was warm & humid outside and we were dying to cool off.

This was a great, centrally located nook, close to Penn station location to spend a weekend in! Comfy beds, and vintage feel. Everything was ready upon our arrival, offered baggage storage too after checkout.

The Good - Wonderful hotel right bang in the center with easy access to all tourist sites, variety of restaurants, and evening entertainment. The hotel has a relaxed atmosphere with staff who are always willing and ready to offer help. Staff here are very very friendly. The beds are amazing with the most soft sheeting that I have ever experienced in any hotel including top 5 stars, a complete wonderful pleasure to sleep in, Quality amenities, which include a shower cap which in the USA hotels is rare. Loved the added touch of providing a Life water bottle, useful when traveling as we did in July's hot weather. A large flat screen 50' TV with netflix kept everyone happy after a long days sightseeing. The Bad - You are not told of the hefty resort fee daily charge per room of $25, when booking, or on departure. The hotel also failed to make us aware of this charge on departure, as no check out invoice was provided. I only became aware of the charge when my bank statement was checked. The hotel takes the charge without notification, which reduced the value and pleasure of our stay at the hotel.

Enjoyed the boutique hotel, large rooms, great air conditioning considering 90 plus temps, extremely comfortable huge bed, huge TV, great to have coffee and tea and a quick bagel in the morning. Offer filtered water from a dispenser. Easy acces to subway, walk to Times Square. Not much for bar scene and restaurant was in transition, so not open. One right next store though and a few down the street with happy hours, etc. Could use some room decor, but overall it was great.

Small room but very clean and comfortable. Bed was a1 and linen was clean and crisp. The hotel is in a great area close to penn station and Madison square. Close to everything really. Was very happy for the price, which for mid-town New York, was very reasonable. It will not disappoint. Nice bar downstairs and great- looking intimate restaurant that was not open when we were there.

What a disappointment. Pictures are a lot better than the reality. Don't be fooled by it. Stay away!Plus:Location if you like the busy tourist areas. And little Korea or Nomad area. Outside of the building. Very beautiful and charmingMinus:Rooms are very very small :( No space to move around, certainly not if you take the double queen rooms!Website promises welcome cocktails for the guests but when we arrived there wasn't even a bar in the hotel... And no other form of extra was offered. No breakfast in hotel possible. Coupons for restaurants in the area..No porter service. Wifi did not work. Room had a very small window. No day light. Beds are way too soft. old matresses. Service is not that special. Evening staff was very unfirendly. Morning staff was friendly. Way to expensive for what you get in returnIn short: stay away if you can!!

My mom and I stayed at Life for 3 nights. We checked a couple of rooms of the type that I booked, and heaters weren't working, unfortunately. However, the staff was very accommodating, especially Kevin!! He tried fixing the heaters, brought us the space heater to use in the meantime, and even some hot delicious tea. Kevin really made our stay, and his friendly personality is a big asset to Life Hotel. Thank you very much!

I stayed at the Life Hotel for a week in July for business and was impressed. The customer service was great, Monica assisted me when I arrived from my redeye flight and was very cordial and welcoming. My room was clean and cool, I used the gym to get a nice sweat and enjoyed the complementary 24-hr coffee a couple of times. I would highly recommend for business or personal travel.

Loved this hotel for our quick stay in New York. It was in a great location, close to the subway and Penn Station. The rooms were small, but clean, stylish and very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel and will gladly stay here again.

Everything was good. Bed, insulation, price, location, parking, position to metro and things to see. All perfect. Nice little extras like pure water, small breakfast and coffee for free and nice little gym.

The hotel was beautiful, well appointed and expertly designed. My only complaint is that the AC wasn't strong enough. I highly recommend staying here. Koreatown and NoMad make this one of the most interesting areas in NYC for tourists and non-tourists alike. I wish I spent more time exploring the hotel. I left a pair of earrings in the room, so when I go back to pick them up I'll be sure to check out the bar. <3<3<3

It’s well located. The staff at front desk were really nice!! The rooms are clean and more spacious than we thought, enough to accommodate luggage without feeling cramped. Our phone didn’t work the first days but other that that, our stay was great. Beds are confortable and great size. Appreciate the absence of rugs and the air conditioner. Overall experience was very good. Henry’s restaurant with very good pizzas. Good relation cost-benefit!

Room was very nice,clean and comfortable. Great location. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Check in and out was a breeze. Upon checking we were given metal reusable water containers with hotels logo. Interesting hotel as it is in the headquarters of the old Life Magazine.

We arrived and the concierge had given us a free upgrade- and 2 free tin water bottles! Our new room was perfectly set up with 2 queen beds and a terrace all to ourselves- with a view of the Empire State Building! The bed was supremely comfy, shower was luxurious, and the staff and everything else about our visit was perfect. Be sure to set up some sort of parking before you arrive though, we only parked for 12 hours in a garage but it was $60. Would stay again.

Stayed here for a night. The price was right, the room smallish but delightfully quirky. Very clean , bed was very comfy and the room was appointed with some really cool features like an odd ceiling light and a 48" TV. Our room was quiet (6th floor) The hotelis around the block from koreatown which is a pretty cool place to walk around on a Saturday night. But it is in a really great location in Manhattan. I highly recommend staying here if what your looking for is comfort clean and withing reasonable walking distance of a lot of attractions.

Not only was our room—four (4) girls—elegant and clean, the staff was super helpful and very friendly. For a hotel in NYC, the setup still accommodated four girls getting ready at once—which isn't easy. The location was also convenient and definitely safe.

I stayed at the Life Hotel in March 2018 with my wife and teen daughter. The location was excellent - an easy walk from Penn Station and the whole city very walkable if you choose.We checked in quite late in the evening and while it went smoothly enough it took longer than I would have expected. We arrived in our room ready for a good night's sleep so we could hit the city full on the next day and just as we were settling in, a horrendous noise erupted from a pipe in the room. Apparently this is the heating system/ radiators, is a known issue, and absolutely disturbed our sleep each of the three nights we stayed.Compounding this concern was the fact, though we had been promised an upgrade via email earlier in the week, we did not receive one upon arrival.The first morning I spoke with Monica at the front desk. She was nice enough, and had obviously heard both of my concerns from other customers because though she dealt with my complaint quite professionally, it was obvious from her face this was not the first time this had come up for both issues. She'd promised to look into moving our room for us while we were out that day but by the time I had reached my room five minutes later, called me to tell me no other rooms were available that would provide a different experience. She then asked me to hold so I could speak to the manager, Denise (I think), who is apparently a really nice lady. I wouldn't know because after listening to muzak for six minutes I hung up. No-one called me back.In the end, the room was good enough for our needs. It's not spacious, but we know better than to expect that in NYC. It was clean and quiet enough outside of the heating system. I can't stress enough how loud it is. It actually became quite laughable and we play a video of it for our friends from time to time, who are astonished listening to it.All in all, a hotel with a lot of possibilities, but customer service, misleading emails and in-room solitude were found wanting.

In the past 10 years 10-15 turn of the century buildings have been converted into boutique hotels in a 3 block square area - 30 to 33 street, 6th Ave to Madison Ave. Life Hotel is one of the newest renos. They cleaned the beaux art facade of this former Life Magazine building. And they built out a small handsome restaurant next door and another off the lobby. They did not create a breakfast space - just a coffee machine in the 2nd floor corridor. The beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are stylishly finished in old NYC black and white tiles. But the rooms are small - only good for sleeping. The reception desk can fit in a closet. But we dont stay in hotels to look at facades or reception desks. We want sleep - and that is the problem. The traffic noise on 31st Street goes all night because 1) 2 other westbound streets are closed at 7th avenue - 27th and 31 Sts. And westbound traffic cannot turn from 34th St. So the trucks, the fire engines, and the police cars all take 31st St. They blow their horns, turn on their sirens, and blast their loudspeakers. At 2 am I found a solution. Turn the air conditioner fan to high. The roar drowns out the car/truck cacophony. Check out all the hotel offerings in this Nomad area

Just back from 9 nights on a business trip. The hotel exceeded my expectations. Bed was very comfy and the room was an oasis - as in the photos. My room was long and skinny, it felt huge by NY standards. I needed to work in my room for a few days so this is why I chose the hotel, the room didn't feel cramped when I needed to stay in. I don't think I had any interaction with hotel staff aside from check in and check out, for me this was fine! The bar is a great place to hang out and restaurant looked very nice. I saw how difficult managing a hotel can be when checking out - a woman wearing flip flops was aggressively complaining over lack of light coming in from her window. Really? The buildings are tall, its noisy and its expensive for little space. Why would you come if you weren't expecting these things?The other thing is the great location - steps from Macys (didn't go) and other stores and many food options. I frequented Koreatown to have dinner - the hotel is in the middle of it.One thing I would suggest is stepping up the environmental policy - the usual stuff of giving the option to keep the same towels etc. The water filtration and water bottle was an excellent idea. The other thing is keeping a folder in the room as finding the hotel info was a bit fiddly - and not mentioned on check in.

Absolutely adore this little hotel. Bohemian and luxurious at once. The bed was incredibly comfy! Breakfast was very good too. Clean, comfortable room with characterful details like the luxury toiletries. Speakeasy in the basement, nice warm friendly restaurant. Koreatown just around the corner which is great. So convenient for mid-town. Friendly and helpful staff. I loved my stay here and it would be my choice again if I'm ever in Manhattan again.

Our stay at the Life Hotel was truly a First class,enjoyable experience from start to finish. We visit NYC 2x a year and have stayed in several hotels, but Life Hotel was by far the most amazing!! From the moment we entered to check in, we were treated with respect. The front desk staff was MORE than welcoming and accommodating in addition to being informative of what to expect with our stay with them. I would like to give an extra special

We got in late in the evening and were met by Matthewwho was extremely friendly and helpful. He told us we had the best room in the hotel and I’m sure he was telling the truth. We had two large, very comfortable beds and an amazing terrace! It was very quiet too. This was the best hotel I have ever stayed in, in NY. I will be back!

I liked this place very much. No fuss, clean, refurbished. Simple buffet breakfast at lobby. It was like having a small apartment in the city. It has history too. Old LIFE magazine HQ. Bed was comfortable.

I really enjoyed my stay here. I had a reservation at the Moderne (who promptly cancelled two days before I was due to fly, despite it being booked weeks in advance, they basically bumped me to their sister hotel as I had secured a great rate. The place looked terrible, so I booked Life instead).As for Life hotel - it's great. The location is 10/10. The beds are huge, so comfortable, with beautiful soft sheets. The rooms have so much space. Bathroom is beautiful. Amenities are perfect - ice and filtered water available every other floor, fridge on request, two lifts to take you up to the rooms, really nice take away and keep water bottle provided. You can text the concierge 24 hours for any requests - I asked for an iron and additional hangers and this was provided promptly to me. The hotel has tons of style and the decor is really nice and modern. Huge tv and plenty of channels, bath and shower available, room service cleaned my room beautifully and at request of different times each day according to my schedule. I couldn't fault this place and would love to stay again.

I got a hotel because my Airbnb cancelled on me a week before. Airbnb did nothing to help me find another place and gave me no compensation. I've had it with Airbnb. Sure, Life Hotel is more expensive than an Airbnb, but you don't have to deal with all the crap that comes with an Airbnb. How am I going to get my keys? When is the host going to show up? Is the host going to show up? Is there a towel? Is there soap?I hesitate to even write about Life Hotel because if I write about it people will actually find out about it and then there goes my little secret. It's a new boutique hotel and the room was enormous by NYC standards. The rate was the cheapest I found on Manhattan. If I can stay here each time I visit Manhattan, I would be very satisfied.

Room size was very good, and very comfortable. The room had a patio (10th floor) so it was great. Decent restaurant, decent bar, excellent location. Access to many stores and good restaurant in the area.

I reserved a room here from a associates recommendation and was pleasantly surprised. Nice rooms / good bar - did not get a chance to try the restaurant but everyone says its is great. Would stay again. What made it special was the fact that it is the old LIFE MAGAZINE BUILDING that was cool.

The hotel was beautifully remodeled. The touches were amazing such as, the bathroom finishes. In a city where even the high end hotels don't seem provide amenities, this one does-coffee bar, gym, filtered water for water bottles. Great location and great price point!

We stay at Life whenever we need an overnight or two in NYC. The staff is very helpful and kind. The roomsare clean and bright, the beds very comfy and the bathrooms fabulous. The dining facilities and bar on the first floor are great. Great central location in Koreatown, easy access to subway and Amtrak.

Great location at the foot of the Empire State Building giving easy access to all areas of downtown Manhattan. Lovely bar and restaurant and a lively speak easy bar in the basement. Free coffee machines on a number of floors for residents to use. Staff were excellent and were happy to move my wife and I after the first night to a quieter room. Our first room was quite nosey as was placed next to a courtyard containing generators. Would stay again.

review_body: From the moment I walked in, the staff was warm, helpful, friendly and accommodating beyond being my accommodations. Everyone made us feel like they liked having us, they were our new friends. We even had some inside jokes with some of them. Also, the restaurant is fantastic as is the speakeasy downstairs. Some days we had to make ourselves leave our 1 block radius because we hadn't seen more than our immediate neighborhood. I also loved the fact that the building had such an illustrious history. I miss all of our new friends at Life Hotel. Oh, also, the mini fridge is empty so you can put your own food and drinks in there. So thoughtful!

The staff was friendly and very accommodating! I made a last minute booking (the day before) for a birthday surprise and they managed to put big helium balloons in room before the check-in. The room was so beautifully decorated and filled with everything you need to feel comfortable. Highly recommend!

This is the only hotel I stay at in NYC Very cleanGreat locationLove Henry the restaurant Sassy and unique cocktailsEveryone is very friendlyI feel secure at LIFEThe speakeasy downstairs is very nice and upbeat

I would have given more stars if there was hot water. The décor is fabulous, with a terrific restaurant on the ground floor, excellent bar on the ground floor plus a gorgeous, fun speakeasy bar underground. The rooms and bathrooms are decorated nicely and on trend (white tiles with glam gold bathroom hardware, all white bedroom with brass beds, fresh art and modern lighting). The bed was extremely comfortable and my room was very quiet (room 206). It wasn't a huge room but of acceptable size; my friend had a TINY room that was VERY loud (room 103). My biggest complaint was that there was no hot water!!! I had read this in other reviews and was hoping it would be fixed but they must have broken water tanks. I would stay here again if I could get a guarantee there was hot water, or I'd make sure the hot water works immediately after checking in...and change rooms if it doesn't. There are a few stairs to get into the hotel and no doorman/bellman so be warned if that matters to you. And there is only one elevator so be prepared to wait if you can't take the stairs. There is also a terrific little gym and coffee station on the 2nd floor.

Why they charge you for your entire stay upfront is the first thing that irritates you, small rooms and no service exceeding a three-star level is when you realize you are in a place people only stay once. The breakfast was nicely prepared, but people let you sit until you figure out yourself it is kind of self-service... if you plan to spend practically no time in your room and get a good price probably something for one time, but no place to revisit.

I’ve never written a negative review but I feel I have to. For the money -there are no services at all. No door man/bell man -not even an offer to help you up the stairs with luggage. At check in they charge your card for the entire stay upfront- plus $200 in case of incidentals. Soon after I checked and I realized why they charge you upfront so you couldn’t leave without paying. Not sure what incidentals that would be because it’s a cashless hotel and no services. The people at the front desk were rude. Not friendly-and btw I am a NY’er living in another state - so I have a high tolerance for rude. The room was super tiny. Fitting for one person. That’s it. When you shower you heat up your entire place. The first shower I had cold water as well. Not pleasant. I left the air running constantly since you hear everything your neighbor is saying. Several times I had a questions—very simple-whether i was just needing change to tip the cleaning people and each time I was offered “no.” Not remotely helpful and each time I felt like I was bothering them. My second to last day I returned to my room after my meetings at 3 PM and the room had not been cleaned. Someone knocked on my door at 3:30 and asked to clean but I had an event that night and told them they had to come back at five. A few minutes later after I got into the shower someone opened my door and walked in- it was the head of housekeeping saying that 5 o’clock was too late to which I said I’m in the shower - please just leave me some towels. So my room was not cleaned. There are so many wonderful hotels in New York City for the price of this one you’ll be better off staying somewhere else. You would think being so new they’d try harder. The only redeeming part of this stay was they made a good margarita pizza at the bar. Even that was not a friendly experience. Shop around.

review_body: Small hotel based in old Life Magazine building. Good location. Easy walk to various sights.Small bedroom but very clean and well appointed. Bar/restaurant area lively and always busy. Food excellent in restaurant but not cheap. Must book a table during busy season.
