London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Quality fixtures and fittings in the room. The room was immaculately clean and very well furnished. I was a single traveller and the room was perfect! The location is central (Top of Chelsea- heading into Mid Town) with lots of options for places to eat & have coffee nearby. I had coffee/juice in the mornings at the hotel and they were excellent quality, I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel was under refurbishment when I stayed, no restaurant, workmen everywhere!The room was clean, but tiny.Outside of my room was a cupboard that they had put a ice machine inside, problem was that it kept overheating and then beeping, until I had to call reception to come and fix it. I stayed 5 night and has to report this problem 7 times, 2 were in the early hours of the morning. Also, the cleaning staff start VERY early, 4 am, and are very noisy, talking, banging.Only 1 lift was working, not idea.So as I said, ok but A LOT could be improved!

First, actual room size has NOTHING to do with what you will see in the picture. In a room that was supposed to be for two guests we had to leave our suitcases in the bathroom! The first day we had no hot or even warm water, the second day WE HAD NO WATER at all and the man at the front desk, way far from giving an excuse just said "all NYC has problems with water"!!!!! Amazing!!!! Trust me, for the price we had to pay, because this is not even a cheap hotel, there are dozens of places around the same location and with a decent (not even need to be good) service

Was apprehensive about the size of hotel rooms in New York, without having to pay exorbitant prices and originally booked Pod Hotel in time square knowing what to expect, but for the same price took a chance on Life Hotel and glad we did. Fantastic sized room (king premium) with a huge bed and floor space! Minimalistic but had all we needed for a 5 night stay. 60inch TV, loads of plug sockets, small closet with safe, hair dryer, dimmer lighting in the room and bathroom, huge ceilings, gorgeous lights, worlds most comfortable bed, lovely hard wood floors, mosiac tiles in bathroom which was huge too, fluffy towels, slippers and bathrobes, lush smelling toiletries, loved the daily makeup wipe they left after making up the room everyday! Never ate at the restaurant but it was always busy and a buzzing evening atmosphere in the bar. We were in room 907, and couldn't hear a thing from the busy Korea town night life. Had a great 12 hr sleep after getting to new york and that set us up for the rest of the trip. A short walk to 34th Herald St station and Penn Station means you can get to central park end, world trade area, soho, harlem, brooklyn and queens easily. Walk 12 mins to times square, 5 mins to MSG, 12 min subway to Rockafeller plaza, stones throw to Macys and all of the shops, superb location allowing us to move freely around the city. Purchase a 7 day unlimited metro card, this lets you use the subway and buses. Learn what direction your heading in and its easy to navigate, lots of police and train people to help you if you make a wrong turn....mainly from gawping at the sheer height of buildings. Oh and it's about 3 mins to empire state, which you might miss if you're not looking up! All in all a memorable New York break in a fab hotel, would definitely stay again, friendly helpful staff, cleaned daily, free hot drinks, handy complimentary water bottles, filtered water and ice, gym...i could go on and on! Stay here! You won't be disappointed, I just hope they don't increase the prices so that it becomes too exclusive!

We travelled from the U.K. so had a long flight. Upon arriving I was a little unsure as the hotel was smaller than others we have stayed in New York but then that’s its charm. We were not greeted by people to take our luggage and after a long flight I was concerned to what to expect after a very informal relaxed check in. However this again is its charm after a good nights sleep we hit New York and returned to the hotel to be greeted by the same faces who all recognised us and made us feel at home. They interacted with our daughter asked us about our day and could not do enough for us. If you want a hotel with a lovely atmosphere and a great price this is the place. The food in the restaurant is amazing and the cocktails are great. Will definitely go back and have recommended the hotel to lots of people already

Our room has not been cleaned for more than 48 hours. Generally the service of the front house team very poor and disappointing. NOT value for money at all. While complaining we have not been proposed for any type of compensation, which shows the team take the hotel’s guests for granted and there is no genuine care.Great Location - but that’s it.

This will not be a full review, but as a general overview. this is a a quaint refurbishment. The building used to be the offices of Life Magazine. Evidently, staff writers used too live above the offices and workshops. The lobby has a dining room and bar. There is wood paneling and late 1800 fixtures. The rooms are small, but comfortable. The bathrooms are spacious and have marble finishes. My room had no view, but I am guessing that is common in this part of the city. The ceilings are high and floors are wood. The place has a great deal of charm. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is good, a few blocks from Herald Square in Koreatown. About a 10 minute walk from Madison Square Garden. I would definitely stay here again.

I booked this hotel. I choose the slightly higher price, allowing me to pay at the hotel upon arrival. I am due to go to New York day after tomorrow. I received a notification that they tried to debit my account on Sunday. The very same day they cancelled my booking. I email them asking why and that now I am stuck trying to find a hotel 2 days before I leave in the area I need to be in. They ignored my email and they are fully booked. I understand mistakes happen but to not respond to an email, is shoddy.Listen, there are better hotels that won’t jerk you around. Don’t bother

About the best thing I can say about this hotel is they let me check in early on the day of arrival. Here is a list of issues I encountered during my 3 night stay:1) the TV system did not work basically for two days, and I was told (in a nice way) to deal with it. The front desk said Maintenance would come to my room - didn’t happen.2) I called the desk at 10pm to set up a wake-up call, and was put on hold for 15 minutes before I hung up. I would set the alarm clock, but my room didn’t have one.3) my key did not work in the afternoons when I got back to the hotel, forcing me to go back downstairs to get a working key.4) after checking me in, they checked someone else into my same room. She came right on in as I was unpacking.5) the bed pillows are the most uncomfortable pillows I have ever slept on.Its a great location, but that’s about it. I wouldn’t recommend it.

Stayed for 2 nights for a work conference. While the location is great and they did a nice job on the rooms with crisp all white decor if you get one of the smaller rooms be advised they are tiny. I couldn’t even pull out my desk chair properly, have room to open my luggage on the floor - yes that tiny. Because it’s a old building, there are a lot of clanging and weird noises at night. I did complain and they disconnected the radiator which was the source of 90% of the noice My wifi did not work in the room my entire stay. They couldn’t figure it out so I had to go to the lobby to do some work which was a pain I also called for a wake up call and was on hold for 15min because the front desk said they were busy checking in guests. Literally one person does it all! If you can get a larger room and get a great deal and don’t mind that you are not getting many amenities than this place will be fine

We travel often to NYC and we like to try different options. Life Hotel will definitely be on our list of hotels to return to in the future. The hotel is very new and has a really great vibe to it - young, well kept, good food and fun atmosphere. It is in a renovated office building and they have done a great job in keeping the character of the place (elevator, stairs, landings, etc.) and updating it wonderfully.To begin with, the staff is lovely. The woman who checked us in was fantastic and helped us select a room that we really enjoyed. Upon checkout, we realized that a bad storm was on the way and we needed to cut our trip short by one day. Without any problem, the hotel allowed us to check out early and refunded our last night - really nice!!!!The rooms are brand new and very well designed. The TVs are huge and the furnishings are modern and fun. The bathrooms are well kept and the rainshower heads are fun. I don't think that any rooms have a particular "view", but some face the street, which is fun for people watching. The others are nice and quiet.Another nice plus is that in addition to a lovely cafe and bar in the lobby, they offer free coffee/tea/hot chocolate and water refills all the time. They also have a small fitness center, which is quite a bonus for a well-priced boutique hotel in NYC.The neighborhood is also very good. A little bit east of KoreaTown/Herald Square so not as touristy and near subways and walking distance to the theater district, etc.Congratulations to this new hotel and we look forward to our next visit with Life.

For just over £160 for 4 nights, the hotel had everything you could want. Close to Empire state and various bars.Staff very good, regularly cleaned rooms, water filter unit on each floor, coffee facilities on floor 2. Bar does food and drinks. Had everything you could want really.

I chose this hotel because of its location. I needed to be in Midtown area. This hotel is quite new. The room is clean but not that spacious. It’s NYC, don’t expect the room to be big.They upgraded my room upon arrival. Thank you for that! The area is safe, and many people were still on the street after midnight.I was out all day, so can’t say much about the service and facilities.

Cute hotel but if you book the special life member deal that is advertised, make sure to ask for food dollars and for an upgraded room (was not given at check in). We were only there one night but got the smallest room with a queen instead of the king we booked. Clearly not upgraded though hotel was not full. We were too tired to switch rooms. Also we were right next to noisy elevator and no hot water for showers in the AM. The tiny room was cute but we would have requested to move if we were staying another night. Neighborhood isn’t great but not a bad spot if you are seeing shows. I bet they will work out some kinks the longer they are open. Staff seems confused.

Great room, with a large beautiful bathroom. It was spotless, comfortable and came with a $30 food and beverage credit, what could be better! Well there is a parking garge 2 doors away and they validate, the parking is not free, but it was discounted, so it was a win win. The location is perfect easy walk to anything! Definitely plan on going back! Oh and the front desk staff could not have been nicer.

We stayed for 7 nights. It was our first time in NYC, so we basically just used the hotel for sleep. The bed was a little to soft for us, so the first night was not that good, but then you get used to it.The staff is super friendly and the hotel has a really cool and modern vibe.The restaurant (we had dinner one night) is more expensive than what we expected... but the food is really good.We loved to stay at Life Hotel. We’ll be back, for sure!

Just got back from a 2 day business trip and stayed at the Life Hotel, really wish I woke up in the room there again! Truly wonderful room, incredibly spacious (couldn't believe I was in a room in NYC), high ceilings, huge bathroom, well appointed and very comfortable. A bonus for me was the coffee available 24/7, as well as a fitness room, definitely convenient. The staff was great as well, very welcoming and got me settled in the hotel in no-time even though I arrived very early. Thanks so much for an exceptional visit!

This is a great hotel with several levels of appeal.. The people are amazing. Friendly, professional, courteous and responsive. There was a friendly welcome at the door, the reception person was very attentive and you absorb a wonderful sense of sophistication and calm in the dark wood paneled front lobby. The small elevator is one of only two semi-circular elevators in the city. Our room was small, light, clean and well-organized. The flat panel TV is huge. The WiFi sign-in appeared challenging, so when we were at the front desk, we asked for help. When we got to our floor, the tech guy was already there, waiting to help us. The room water is hot. Bathrobes are a pleasant touch. Recommend the restaurant. Breakfast is creative. Dinners are excellent. Overall, this hotel is an elegant experience. If you need further eats, there is a superb deli close by : "Bread and Butter" . Try it, you'll like it.

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for my first trip to New York...We arrived at the hotel early and they let us check in early.. when we arrived to the room it was clean- but a work man just walked in to fix the bathroom without knocking.As stated on the website it says that robes and slippers are provided- which are needed on concrete floors and these were not provided- even though we were in a king room.The walls are paper thin even though they look old and sturdy... We asked to move after 2 nights next to a family with a child that screamed all night but just got told to put up with it. With jet lag and no sleep for 2 days this is not the answer we wanted to hear.The gym is small and is fine for 2 but you have to walk up 2 flights for water. The interior and decoration is modern and cool but the basics are missing. Customer service was very sub optimal and we won't be recommending this hotel to friends and colleagues

Had an amazing 2 night stay at The Life Hotel recently. The property has really made amazing leaps since they first opened and the hotel is a perfect spot for business or pleasure. Great central location, easy to get everywhere in Manhattan. Staff were all friendly and accommodating...room was fantastic, great big bathroom with beautiful tile. Bed was super comfortable, huge flatscreen TV and lots of cool little touches and art.Had drinks at the speakeasy downstairs to start the night and was really impressed with the design and staff...cocktail was great and had the mini potato knishes with caviar (YUM!). Then had an exceptional meal upstairs at Henry. Our server was probably the best I've had anywhere, and everything we ordered was really unique and special. Connected to the lobby, the overall vibe was amazing, amazing music too!Highly recommend this place.

Overall we were very pleased with our room. It was fairly clean, the bed was comfortable, and thought was put into 'landing spots' for the stuff we carry. The room was on the small size but fine for 2 married tourists. My one request (and this goes for most hotels) is they could have used a few more hooks - in bathroom and also near the door. Our room overlooked 31st and while there was street noise, it wasn't terribly noticeable to me (it was to my husband) - especially when we had the wooden shutters closed. The windows could stand to be replaced as their was certainly a draft coming in - and this was February. I didn't mind it as I like fresh air however it's not the best from the standpoint of conserving energy and noise reduction. If you don't care for the things that come with a quirky/historic hotel, I'd book elsewhere. Personally I liked the feel of the room and building. The bar (and restaurant) are part of/off the lobby. It was a great place to have a drink and had a cozy vibe. Unfortunately I didn't make it down to Gibson + Luce (and that was the reason I booked here). 24/hour tea/coffee/hot cocoa stations were very appreciated as well.

Recently opened, and absolutely immaculate! Neighborhoods noisy-buI h hang once in my room! Beds are super comfortable and quite spacious for NYC. Restaurant t open yet s the oded a lovely continental with yogurt,cereal,fruit, pastry and juice all gratis! Would definitely return again if the price was right!

Nice style to it, from the overall decor to the artwork. Has a nice overall feel of luxury without being obnoxious or ridiculously expensive. Good size room for manhattan. Good, convenient location. Ask one of the staff to tell you about the history of the place--very interesting!

review_body: I travel for business frequently and have been coming to Life for the past few months. It has everything I need as a business traveler-1. Fantastic convenient location2. Great fast (& free) Wi-fi3. Very quiet rooms (request the back of the hotel rooms)4. Very friendly and accommodating staff- ie I needed an iron and they brought it up super quick5. On site 24/7 gym6. Small biz center but good enough Bonus was the really great restaurant and lower level speakeasy cocktail bar. Even though I have an expense account, I am a sucker for a good deal (and so is my boss) and when I saw on their website they offered a $30 daily food and beverage credit as part of one of their packages I booked it. I had read about the restaurant and the bar opening and love checking out a new trendy spot. It was perfect for breakfast in the morning (spent $10) and a night cap cocktail ($14) at the bar at night- all with my daily $30 credit. At breakfast, I had the most incredible egg sandwich “Best Egg Sandwich in NYC” and it actually lived up to its name. I’m a self-proclaimed coffee snob so was really happy to see they support a great roaster- Brooklyn Roasting Company. Overall, I highly recommend Life Hotel for business travel – really checks off all the boxes. Already booked for next month.

I heard about the new renovated hotel in the former Life Magazine building and thought it seemed great for my upcoming business trip. I am happy to say it exceeded all expectations and look forward to future business trips to NYC. The service was truly 5 star from the doorman to the front desk to the entire team at Henry and Gibson & Luce. The room was very spacious, especially the bathroom with a full tub and amazing shower. The amenities such as complimentary coffee all day, 24/7 gym and texting service for extra towels was seamless. Only regret was only having breakfast and snacks at the speakeasy only, the food at their restaurant, Henry looked amazing which I must try next time. I look forward to returning!

Great hotel – will definitely stay here again. Conveniently located close to subway and walking distance to so many NYC tourist spots. Really friendly staff, good size room, lots of sunlight (ask for a room in the front of the building), free wifi and super comfy bed. Pretty cool restaurant and speakeasy bar as well. Looking forward to coming back soon!

Had a great stay at Life Hotel with the Mrs. For us, it’s all about location as we like to make the most of our vacations and really explore the cities we visit. The hotel is right in the middle of the city and basically a short ride or walk away from the best spots. We walked along 5th for the shopping and hit Rock Center/Radio City, swung around to Times Square and Madison Square Garden before finishing off at a nearby spot called The Smith for a drink/bite. Back at the hotel our room was great- the bed like others have commented is super comfortable. After walking most of the day, it was so nice to come back to a great shower, slip into our robes and slippers and melt into our bed. I’m sort of a tech junkie so hello 60 inch TV!! I will say my only minor complaint was wish I had a fridge already in our room. We tested out their text line and literally within 10 min it was delivered, and my leftovers were chilling.  Thumbs up Lifers. So, we really like to eat and drink. We were super excited to try the restaurant (Henry) and we happen to be staying the weekend they opened their downstairs speakeasy cocktail bar. Again, thank god for that bed bc we were in a food and cocktail coma- date night done right.  Just a few of our highlights- we suggest- the baked clams, pig presse and meatball pizza! Skipped dessert and opted for drinks in the speakeasy downstairs, Gibson & Luce. We had the best bartender, French guy named Alex. Definitely ask for him as he won’t steer you wrong. Since it was date night we got this crazy cocktail for 2 – the black chicken (make sure you ask your bartender about the cool story behind it!) came in a flask and brown paper bag. Not only was it cute but it tasted great too. So needless to say, me and the Mrs had the time of our LIFE (haha).  Great hotel, restaurant and speakeasy at a really great price, what a memorable trip. We will definitely be back!

We stayed at the Life Hotel last weekend for my husband’s birthday and enjoyed every minute of it. Great amenities and value for the price- super comfortable bed, classy décor and products. The hotel also has a unique history and central location that just added to the experience. We highly recommend staying at the hotel, dinner or breakfast at Henry’s, and nightcap at Gibson +Luce speakeasy-- which is a trip in itself watching the unique cocktails being created and enjoyed.

I have been traveling to NY for business for several years, and Life Hotel is the best hotel experience I have had in a long time. The cold weather during my three stays this month meant I didn’t want to leave the hotel in the evenings, and with their exercise room, new restaurant (Henry) and basement speakeasy, I not only didn’t need to leave, I didn’t want to leave. The rooms are stylish, extremely comfortable, and welcoming. The service is excellent, and the extras include a robe, slippers, and terrific bed and pillows. And after eating 6 meals at Henry, the hotel restaurant, I cannot say enough about the experience. Everything was delicious, and I enjoyed every bite of most everything on the menu. And the room, from the lighting to the music to the service was all pleasure. It all fits together. I can go on, as after dinner I went down to their basement speakeasy, and the mood, lighting, crowd and drinks were perfect. I also enjoyed my breakfast in the morning, which is quick, efficient and delicious. It caters to those who want to eat , have a coffee and get on with the day. I can’t wait till I’m back there again.

The hotel was just renovated! So it is new and clean. We had 2 rooms. The regular one was super small (there was no space to open up the suitcases), our window was facing the patio and there was never any light. The other room was the opposite: pretty big for NYC, with a big window. All the guests are presented with branded water bottle. Water, ice and coffee is available for free 24/7. Check out the restaurant at the Hotel - it is very good! The location is also very convenient.

My girlfriend and I had excellent time with our stay at the Life Hotel. I had some questions beforehand about the status of the construction and emailed the hotel; Katherine the Director of Rooms was lovely and helped answer all my questions very quickly which was appreciated.Our room was beautiful and in a great spot, we loved the style that the hotel was re-done in. The beds were very comfortable, and the city/hotel noise was quite low which made for some great sleeps. The lobby and bar had a great ambiance too.Overall the service made everything easy, the location made it quick to get most places, and the accommodations made for a really memorable stay in the city. We loved it and would totally come back again.
